NOTES: SYNADEC members started a 72-hour strike over violence at universities.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers staged a rally outside the University Hospital Yalgado in Ouagadougou in favour of their demands.
Bakery and pastry workers in Ouagadougou staged a 72-hour strike to demand better living and working conditions.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers staged a protest march to the high commission offices in Bogande in favour of their demands.
Students from the Montaigne mixed private school protested at the Ministry of Secondary and Highert Education to demand the release of their teacher following a business dispute.
Students ransacked Jaul Paul II High School in Sector 29 of Ouagadougou. It was not clear why the students attacked the school, although broader unrest among students has been reported recently.
A few hundred people protested in Ouagadougou for "truth and justice" for Norbert Zongo, on the fourteenth anniversary of the murder of the Burkinabe journalist.
The National Social Security Fund started a 72-hour strike in Banfora to demand safer workplaces.
People protested against SONABEL and invaded the town hall in Ouahigouya over payment issues.
Residents of Passakongo marched to demand the release of 23 people arrested in their area.

Students from the municipal school of Niangoloko rioted in the area, held their principal hostage and assaulted him. They also attacked the house of the president of the EPA and vandalized some municipal vehicles outside the town hall. The students were angry over lack of electricity to their school.
Agents of ONATEL staged a sit-in at their HQ in Ouagadougou to protest over issues with seniority bonuses.

Office workers from different basic education districts (CEB) around Ouahigouya observed a protest movement. The non-consideration of this category of teachers in the annual educational conferences and educational entertainment groups was the cause.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CDP: Congress for Democracy and Progress
NOTES: CDP activists protested in district 4 of Ouagadougou over allegedly irregularities in the mayor of their area. They demanded his departure.
People from Passakongo, joined by people from surrounding villages, marched to demand the release of people arrested in the area.
Students in Dedougou started a 48-hour "warning" strike at the Polytechnic University Center Dedougou over allegedly bad study conditions.
Students protested and attempted to disrupt a visit by the PM to the University of Ouagadougou.
Residents of Tabtenga in sector 45 of Ouagadougou captured two suspected thieves in their area and burned them alive.
The secretary-general of staff representatives at Sahel Spinning (FILSAH) began an indefinite hunger strike to demand attention to the workers grievances.
The miners protested near Boromo over their eviction from mining sites in the area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers adhered to the 96-hour strike in Fada N'Gourma.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers started a 96-hour work stoppage to protest against dismissals and allegedly arbitrary transfers. The strike was observed in Gaoua.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers started a 96-hour work stoppage to protest against dismissals and allegedly arbitrary transfers. The strike was observed at University Hospital Yalgado Ouedraogo in Ouagadougou.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers started a 96-hour work stoppage to protest against dismissals and allegedly arbitrary transfers. The strike was observed at University Hospital Yalgado Ouedraogo in Ouagadougou.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
NOTES: SYNTSHA workers in Seguenega have started a 72-hour strike over the dismissal of a health worker in their area.
A security guard at the main prison in Ouagadougou started a hunger strike and threatened to self-immolate to demand better living and working conditions.
Students in Dedougou started a 96-hour strike, following an earlier warning strike, at the Polytechnic University Center Dedougou over allegedly bad study conditions.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
NOTES: CCVC members and others groups staged a march under their banner to mark Labour Day in Kaya.
Students from Philippe Zinda high school in Ouagadougou walked out of classes in solidarity with teachers who are planning to start a strike on May 10.
Youth organizations staged a march in Ouagadougou to draw attention to Burkina Faso's Millennium Development Goals obligations.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: F-SYNTER: Federation of National Unions of Workers in Education and Research; SNESS: National Union of Secondary and Higher Education
NOTES: F-SYNTER and SNESS teachers started a 24-hour strike in Kongoussi over working conditions.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: F-SYNTER: Federation of National Unions of Workers in Education and Research; SNESS: National Union of Secondary and Higher Education
NOTES: F-SYNTER and SNESS teachers started a 24-hour strike in Koudougou over working conditions.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: F-SYNTER: Federation of National Unions of Workers in Education and Research; SNESS: National Union of Secondary and Higher Education
NOTES: F-SYNTER and SNESS teachers started a 24-hour strike in Nouna over working conditions.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SNESS: National Union of Secondary and Higher Education
NOTES: SNESS teachers started a 24-hour strike over working conditions.

Students from high schools in Ouagadougou clashed with police and republic security company (CRS) forces, resulting in injuries and damage to property during stone-throwing. This followed the announcement of a strike by teachers on May 10.
Protesters removed the keys to the town hall of Bousse and padlocked the door to protest against the new mayor of the city.
Residents from the village of Gorongo stormed the town hall of Oueleni department to protest against the cancellation of Gorongo as an administrative village.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNAPAR: National Union of Research Support Staff
NOTES: SYNAPAR members staged a sit-in at the Institute of Environment and Agricultural Research in Ouagadougou to demand a sepcific allowance and expansion of a premium for their research.
An assassination attempt was reported in the Djibo area. Ansaroul Islam claimed responsibility.
An assassination was conducted in the Sibe area. The identity of the target was not reported. Ansaroul Islam claimed responsibility.
Students in the Niangoloko locality under the banner of the Association of Schools Comoe (CSA) began a 72-hour strike to draw attention to their grievances.
Rallies were held against the continued use of the CFA in Burkina Faso.

Suspected Islamist fighters attacked the Kerboule mining site in Soum province, killing one Koglweogo member and 3 miners, injuring one other, and stealing 6 motorcycles and an unspecified sum of money. Islamist militias have been known to operate in the area.
One person was killed and another injured when Burkinabe soldiers fired warnings shots at approaching motorcycles in the Banh area of Loroum province.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
NOTES: The Union of Lawyers of Burkina Faso (SYNAF) reported that a lawyer had been assaulted by police while he had been attempting to interview a defendant who had been in custody for more than 5 days.
1,500 people marched silently in Ouagadougou to mark the anniversary of the Hotel Splendid attack.
Students in Santa blocked National Road No.7 to demand attention to their grievances.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.

Retired police and soldiers protested and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Defence and Veteran's Affairs in Ouagadougou over the government's non-implementation of a shift in the retirement age.

Heavily armed Islamist militants were reported to have forced their way into schools in areas around Baraboule, including the Petega area of Pelem-Pelem and Lassa, and demanded teachers instruct their students on Islam and the Quran and stop teaching French. Burkinabe soldiers have been deployed to the area following the incidents.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
NOTES: A crowd forced the release of 8 people imprisoned at a police station in Bagre. Following the events, clashes were reported between the rioters and police, which were later reinforced by gendarmerie forces. 37 people were arrested after the incident. No casualties were reported but some property was damaged.
A municipal councilor and his son were killed by unidentified assailants in the Yorsala area, near Titao.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNAFI: National Union of Finance Agents
NOTES: SYNAFI workers began an 11 day sit-in outside the ministry to demand their grievances be addressed.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ONTTB: National Organisation of Burkinabe Land Carriers
NOTES: Truck drivers of the ONTTB protested and blocked the Ouaga-Kaya intersection to demand fewer road checks. They threatened to strike if nothing was done.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYTTBHA: Workers Union of Public Works, Building, Water and Similar
NOTES: SYTTBHA workers protested and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Infrastructure to demand resolution of their grievances.

Employees Safety Assistance Volunteers (VADS) personnel starting to demonstrate in front of the governorate building in Bobo-Dioulasso were quickly cleared by police who used tear gas and batons. A police spokesman said the protest was illegal. No injuries were reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNAMICA: National Union of Agents in the Ministry of Industry, Trade and Handicrafts
NOTES: SYNAMICA union members began a 72-hour strike to demand better working and living conditions.
Youths, civil society members and traders blocked Coulibaly Avenue to protest the suspension of asphalting of the avenue.
Ansaroul Islam fighters attacked 2 police stations in northern Burkina Faso at Baraboule and Tongomayel, injuring the wife of a police officer and destroying as many as 19 police motorcycles.
Ansaroul Islam fighters attacked 2 police stations in northern Burkina Faso at Baraboule and Tongomayel, injuring the wife of a police officer and destroying as many as 19 police motorcycles.
Diguel was attacked by suspected Ansaroul Islam fighters in the early morning of Feb.28. They ransacked the mayors office, stole some property and burned down a prefecture building.
A school principal and another civilian were killed in an attack by suspected Ansaroul Islam fighters on a school in the Djibo area of Soum.
A teacher and another person were killed at Kourfayel in Soum province by suspected Islamist militants.
Schools in the Fourtenga commune of Nassere (Kongoussi) were visited by suspected Islamist militants who threatened to close them down if the teachers did not start teaching in Arabic.
Teachers in Zorgo staged a one-day strike to mourn the killing of a teacher in Kourfayel by Islamist militants.
Teachers marched in Ouagadougou and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Education to protest against initimidation of teachers in Soum by suspected Islamist militants.
A school was burned down in the Baraboule area by suspected Islamist militants. Islamist groups, particularly Ansaroul Islam, have been targeting schools and teachers in the area recently.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNAGRH: National Union of Human Resource Managers and Public Administration
NOTES: SYNAGRH members protested and started a 72-hour sit-in in Ouagadougou to demand attention to their grievances.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SYNAMICA: National Union of Agents in the Ministry of Industry, Trade and Handicrafts
NOTES: SYNAMICA members started a 120-hour strike to demand the government comply with a memo of understanding.
Koglweogo militiamen and an unidentified armed group clashed in the Kereboule area. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
NOTES: A gendarme was injured in an attack by unidentified assailants in an ambush in the Petega area.
Unidentified assailants attacked a joint-police/military camp in Nassoumbou. At least one soldier was wounded in a rocket attack, although gunfire was also reported.
The National Union of Tax Estate Agents started a strike and protested in the capital in favour of their demands.
A youth organization (ODJ) organized a sit-in in Koudougou to protest against water shortages in the city.
A suspected Ansaroul Islam lieutenant was killed by security forces in the Petega area near Djibo. 18 other suspected militants were also arrested.

Unidentified armed individuals on motorcycles raided the HQ of the Koglweogo in Kereboule, which they found empty. They then opened fire for nearly a quarter of an hour before leaving. At least one person was seriously injured during the firing.
Burkinabe soldiers backed by Barkhane forces have started a large-scale search and clear operation in Soum province. Malian forces are also participating across the border.
Kolgweogo in Pouytenga and surrounding areas gathered in Koupela to protest over the alleged condemnation of their comrades.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AFKK: Koglweogo Womens Association of Kouritenga
NOTES: The women's association  Koglweogo Kouritenga protested against a court decision against some of their husbands related to some vigilante activities.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-); Military Forces of Mali (2013-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported between tripartite forces (French, Burkinabe and Malian) and Islamist militants in the Tin Tehegrin area near the Burkina-Niger border.
Residents of Douna staged a march in support of the mayor over alleged activity against him by local representatives of the CDP and the UPC.
44 people were arrested in the Pama and Nadiagou area after protests and arson attacks related to the shooting death of an alleged poacher in the area.
About 200 police protested in Ouagadougou over the alleged lack of transparency over their provision of security to private companies.
44 people were arrested in the Pama and Nadiagou area after protests and arson attacks related to the shooting death of an alleged poacher in the area.
Angry protesters shut one of the main markets in Bobo-Dioulasso and marched to the governorates offices to submit a protest letter over poor roadways.
2 Water Department workers were abducted by unidentified assailants in the Tin-Akoff area. They were later released.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: UPC: Union for Progress and Reform; CDP: Congress for Democracy and Progress
NOTES: Nearly 5,000 supporters of the opposition, primarily UPC and CDP activists, gathred in Ouagadougou outside the People's House for a rally against the government.
A woman was killed when a grenade was thrown at her family while they were resting.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A bicycle taxi driver was arrested, tied up, and beaten by Imbonerakure because he was not carrying his ID. They accused him of belonging to a rebel group.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A small-trader who was collecting a debt from another person was delivered to the Imbonerakure, who beat him. He was then imprisoned for 2 days.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: At least 20 people were arrested and accused of having taken part in an attack on Kayogoro.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Development
NOTES: A member of MSD was assaulted by a member of the CNDD-FDD. His assailant threatened to kill him if he did not adhere to CNDD-FDD

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man was tortured and imprisoned by Imbonerakure. He was accused of criticising the administration.
A woman was abducted and tortured. Her arm was cut off and she was killed. Her body was found two days later near her home.
The governor of Makamba discovered 11 people watching a video together during a curfew patrol. He had them severely beaten.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: A woman was attacked by a CNDD-FDD, then later in the evening her house was burned down.
A man who had fought a policeman in a bar was arrested and detained. In the police cells he was assaulted by 2 policemen

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure assaulted a man and threw his unconscious body in a cornfield because he is not a member of CNDD-FDD

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A woman was assaulted by Imbonerakure at around 7pm.
A Batwa man was beaten to death.
3 youths were arrested and put in a common cell. One was tortured with sticks.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A 17 year old boy was beaten by 3 Imbonerakure.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who had argued with his wife. She pleaded that they not arrest him because their quarrel was domestic.
A man who had been accused of being a rainmaker was killed because of the lack of rains.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A restaurant waiter was beaten by Imbonerakure until he lost consciousness

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man was arrested and beaten up because the police accused him of stealing the deputy head of the commune's kepi. The police and imbonerakure threatened to shoot him in the head and made him pay BIF300,000 to avoid going to prison.
A young girl was attacked by unidentified assailants and seriously wounded.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: The FNL Rwasa vice president was arrested and accused of illegal distribution and possession of weapons. 6 other FNL Rwasa members are being held on the same charges.
A shopkeeper was abducted.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: Police in Gihanga arrested 5 men, including 3 FNL Rwasa activists after a household search. The men were accused of attacking the internal security of the state.
8 people were injured when a grenade exploded in the Church of Heaven. The pastor has been arrested.

A transmission agent for the local police commissioner assaulted 2 men with his belt and fined them BIF100,000. He accused them of having been at a clandestine meeting because they were returning from a bar. The next day the police returned the money to the men so that would not file a case.
The Burundi Minister of the Environment, Emmanuel Niyokuru, was killed by gunmen on his way home.
A woman disappeared from a Gikungu bar. 4 days later her body was found on the shores of Lake Tanganyika.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure staged a march to protest against Rwanda.
A policeman shot at 2 young boys who were herding cattle, killing one and injuring the other.
A staff member of the NGO CARE was abducted by policemen and driven to Bugarama in a civilian car.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man on Masha hill was beaten until he lost consciousness by 2 Imbonerakure. One of them has been arrested.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 2 Imbonerakure beat a man until he lost consciousness because he refused to buy them a drink.
A student detonated a grenade at school, which killed him.
2 people suspected of witchcraft were killed by their neighbours, who wielded clubs and machetes.
3 families were attacked by unkown assailants wielding cudgels. The families were told that they were attacked because they were known to support General Niyombare.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: An imbonerakure assaulted the head of the hill who had demanded a fine.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: A CNDD-FDD party activist was attacked by unknown assailants.
Construction workers discovered a mass grave in Rusaka. 6 skulls have been found.
A woman was killed by villagers, who believed that she was a witch.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure accused a man of stealing a goat and beat him to death. They were arrested but released soon after.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 2 men were decapitated and dismembered by Imbonerakure.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure assaulted a man and a woman and locked them up. The imbonerakure accused them of adultery, but it is believed that they were targeted because the woman is from Musaga, a hot spot during the anti-Nkurunziza protests.
Unidentified armed men killed 2 men and a child in a shooting in Muyira. 6 people have been arrested.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: A CNDD-FDD militant was killed by unidentified assailants. His body was found on 14 January
A man was arrested and beaten by order of the head of the police post, who heard him insulting the police while drunk.
A man was arrested by the police. His body was discovered the next day by the cowherds. The local authorities issued an urgent order to bury the boy without an investigation.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: 2 Imbonerakure attacked an FNL Agathon Rwasa member with machetes. They accused him of having left the CNDD-FDD.
The police carried out a household search. They assaulted a man who resisted them when they attempted to enter his house.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: Unidentified armed men attacked the household of a member of FNL Rwasa. He was injured. One of the attackers was also injured, when neighbours came to his rescue.
A man accused of witchcraft was killed. 10 people have been arrested.
2 brothers were attacked by people throwing grenades at around 11pm. 1 died on the spot and the other was wounded.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure attacked a couple who support UPRONA with machetes.
When soldiers discovered a grenade on a plot, they beat the girl who lived there with their rifle butts until the Deputy Head of the hill intervened.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: An FNL Rwasa supporter was attacked in a bar for resisting joining the ruling party.
A man was attacked by unidentified men armed with guns and machetes.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure clubbed a man to death when he was caught in an act of robbery in a field of beans.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: The administrator of the commune was attacked by Imbonerakure in his home.
A shepherd was killed.
Police assaulted a young man near the Musaga market. When onlookers attempted to help him, they chased them away.
A man and his sister were talking outside her home, when they were apprehended by police and beaten. The man lost consciousness.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 9 youth who did not have identity documents were assaulted by Imbonerakure and then taken to the communal police station.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: An imbonerakure raped a 14 year old school girl as she returned home.

Following the an attack on the Mukoni camp, Warrant Officer Francis Nkunzimana and around 30 other soldiers were arrested and handed over to the police. The next day Nkunzimana's body was found on the savannah, riddled with bullets, along with two other bodies. One of the other soldiers arrested was beheaded. The other soldiers complained of severe torture.

Unidentified gunmen attacked Mukoni Military camp in the early hours of Tuesday morning. Following this incident a patrol went out and burned the savannah where the gunmen were reportedly hiding to flush them out.
A woman's body was found in her home, hacked by machetes.

ACTOR1: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD leader of the Baziro area beat an FNL Rwasa supporter at around 7pm for opposing the payment of contributions to the party building project.
The government of Burundi released 2,500 prisoners (nearly a quarter of the prison population)
Between 7pm and 8pm police overturned stalls and forced traders to close their shops. The traders grew angry and threw stones at the police. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.
Major Dieudonne Karashira was killed at Cankuzo Military camp. A man has been arrested in response.
A body was found on 28/1. The victim was wearing handcuffs and had been shot in the head.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
NOTES: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure marched to demonstrate against the EU report which criticised the Burundian government.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
NOTES: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
NOTES: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
NOTES: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
NOTES: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.
A retired banker was attacked by people wearing military clothes.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
NOTES: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure detained and assaulted a policeman. He was advised by the local head of the police not to report the incident in order to keep the peace.
The head of the Kivyuka Police Station arrested and beat passengers on a taxi travelling at around 7.15pm. He was angry that they were travelling so late, and accused them of possessing weapons.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 5 Imbonerakure assaulted an UPRONA supporter who they accused of participating in the assassination of a chief.
8 policemen entered a household and attempted to arrest 6 people. When one of the men resisted arrest, they beat and tortured him.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 3 Imbonerakure ambushed a man returning from a bar and accused him of trafficking drugs. They forced him to undress and beat him for 2 hours.
2 men were attacked by 15 men armed with machetes.
2 men were attacked by a group of 15 unidentified armed men, wielding machetes.
A woman whose husband had left for Tanzania and her 5 year old child were killed by unidentified assailants.
A man was stabbed to death by unidentified armed forces. His body was found in a field.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure had erected a roadblock to check that all travellers had paid the mandatory contribution to building the stadium. A minibus attempted to get past the barrier and was assaulted by the Imbonerakure. He called the police, who came to break up the roadblock.
An armed group attacked the shops in Rukaramu. Soldiers apprehended and fought them. The armed group fled, abducting 3 people.
A man from Kiranda hill was wounded in a machete attack.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The head of the Imbonerakure on Gatabo Hill beat and arrested a former CNDD-FDD leader from the region. He accused the CNDD-FDD leader of disrupting security by speaking loudly inside his house.
A man was shot by unidentified gunmen.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
NOTES: A FRODEBU activist wass beaten to death by a crowd of residents who accused him of having stolen a bag of rice.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure created a roadblock to carry out identity checks on passers-by. They confiscated people's bicycles and made them sit on the ground. 6 people who resisted the Imbonerakure were beaten.
2 people were killed and another seriously injured in an attack by unidentified gunmen in Gatumba. In the same attack another 6 people were abducted and reportedly taken to the DRC.
Refugees from Kavumu Camp demonstrated against the delay in food delivery. They began to throw stones at the WFP and UNHCR workers. Police disrupted the demonstration by firing into the air.
A man who was recently released from prison was attacked. He was wounded in the head and left to die.
A military major in civilian clothing was arrested by a policeman at a roadblock. When he demanded to know why he had been arrested, the policeman beat him and confiscated his phone.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: The police and Imbonerakure carried out an identity check. 50 people without identity cards were arrested. The Imbonerakure beat them and accused them of being thieves and criminals.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A group of Imbonerakure assaulted a man who had attempted to preempt a thief.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
NOTES: The communal head of FRODEBU was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure, wielding metal whips.
A man was beaten to death.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report.
A local official and MPs led a march against the human rights report. Residents were threatened with fines of BIF50,000 if they did not participate in community work and the march.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure held a march at 3am, they ran through the streets singing intimidating songs. Residents were afraid that they were being attacked.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report.
After Saturday community work, everyone was forced by the authorities to participate in a demonstration against the human rights report.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report.
A demonstration against the human rights report was led by the Governor of Gitega Province and other MPs.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD held a protest against the human rights report. Imbonerakure assaulted passers-by.
The authorities and heads of departments organised a demonstration against the UN report. Attendance was compulsory for high school students and government workers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
NOTES: A member of the FRODEBU party was assaulted in a bar by the National Intelligence Service. They accused him of launching bombs.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure held a demonstration to protest against the EU.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 20 Imbonerakure who had noticed that a man had been taking photographs of a demonstration on his cell phone confiscated his cell phone and assaulted him.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A demonstration against the human rights report was held in Rutegama after the Saturday community work. The students from the Lycee Communal were forced to attend both the community work and the demonstration.
A security guard for Tanganyika Sugar Company in Gihanga was abducted from his post. His mutilated body was discovered 2 days later.
A caretaker of the Tanganyika Sugar Company was abducted. His decapitated body was discovered 2 days later.
A motorcyclist was arrested and beaten by 2 policemen. When they dumped him at the IDP camp in Bugendana, people were outraged over his condition. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man who was accused of embezzling money was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: An FNL Rwasa activist was abducted by Imbonerakure. He was beaten and then held in the police cells. He is in critical condition
A man who the CNDD-FDD had been pressuring to join the party was attacked in his home. His wife and neighbour were killed. The family believes that the perpetrators are CNDD-FDD militants
A man was hacked to death by a machete.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: An Imbonerakure was beaten by other Imbonerakure for missing the protest on 11 February.
A man was kidnapped by unidentified assailants. He was discovered 2 days later.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
NOTES: A young man was abducted by Imbonerakure. He was held by the SNR, but has subsequently disappeared.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: The head of the Rutegama police post beat up an FNL Rwasa supporter who tried to intervene in a dispute between the police chief and some motorcyclists.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.
Civil Society organisations close to the CNDD-FDD held a protest to demand the arrest of opposition leaders and their exclusion from the Arusha process.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 2 Imbonerakure assaulted a disabled person and stole his  wheelchair.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: 30 members of FML Rwasa who were meeting were attacked by Imbonerakure.
An ex-FAB disappeared from his home.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
NOTES: An MSD leader was assaulted by Imbonerakure, who accused him of causing divisions amongst the Imbonerakure youth.

ACTOR2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 2 Imbonerakure forced shops to close and destroyed kiosks. Clashes broke out when the shopkeepers rebelled. The head of the hill had to intervene.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure assaulted 2 men and fined them BIF240,000. They were accused of robbery.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A girl at the Matana hospital was assaulted by Imbonerakure for breaking curfew. 2 students who attempted to defend her were also assaulted.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 2 Imbonerakure beat and arrested a man. They accused him of stealing manioc because he had been looking for his goats.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man was tied up and beaten by 4 Imbonerakure, who accused him of stocktheft.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: When military forces in Butihinda discovered military uniforms they carried out mass arrests of Imbonerakure. One of the Imbonerakure arrested was beaten and taken to an unknown location.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man was beaten publicly by Imbonerakure, who accused him of witchcraft.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: Members of FNL-Rwasa were beaten by 7 Imbonerakure as they returned from a meeting at around 8pm.
A family was victims of a grenade attack. 2 of the children died.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 3 people who were arrested and severely tortured by police and Imbonerakure while in custody. 2 died from their wounds.
A man was injured when unidentified armed men opened fire in a bar.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.
A grenade went off at 8pm, injuring a woman and her 2 children.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD held a march to protest the Arusha protest. Students from local schools were forced to attend.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: The CNDD-FDD Women's Forum held a march to protest the Arusha dialogues.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A butcher was beaten by Imbonerakure as he was returning home at 10pm.
A man was blindfolded and tied up, and then killed and dumped in a river. His body was found near the Gitega market.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A youth who refused to join the CNDD-FDD was beaten by the area chief and imbonerakure and then detained in solitary confinement.
A grenade was thrown in the Kumpuzumahanga market. There were no injuries. President Nkurunziza was due to give a speech nearby the following day.
Several thousand people protested in the streets of Burundi's capital Bujumbura against UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres and the facilitator in the inter-Burundian crisis.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: The FNL Rwasa Party Secretary was assaulted by 5 Imbonerakure as he returned home at 9.15pm.
A man was arrested by the head of the Karuzi police and beaten until he spit blood and lost consciousness.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency; CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest the UN report on Burundi. The march was lead by the local head of the National Intelligence Service. Students at the Lycee Communal refused to participate in the march, to the displeasure of the headmaster.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure held a march to demonstrate against Belgian interference in Burundi

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: CNDD-FDD members held a demonstration to show their support for the government and to denounce the UN report on Burundi. Imbonerakure present threatened outsiders who tried to approach the march.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man who was visiting Kanyinya from Kanyagu was arrested and beaten by 2 Imbonerakure at a roadblock when he refused to give them money.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); UPRONA: Union for National Progress
NOTES: 8 members of FNL Rwasa and 2 members of UPRONA were arrested and beaten by the police and Imbonerakure. They had gathered to comfort an FNL Rwasa colleague who had lost a family member, but were accused of holding a clandestine meeting.
Students in Bigomogomo go on strike over school costs.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A man was assaulted by Imbonerakure when he failed to return home before the curfew. He was forced to pay a 5000BIF fine.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD: National Council for Democracy and Development
NOTES: The head of the national intelligence service and the head of the police assaulted 6 CNDD-FDD members using an iron whip. The CNDD-FDD members had been discovered with a grenade in a bar.
Students who have been on strike since 6 March, came under fire from Police in Bigomogomo. No reported injuries.
An ex-FAB went missing as he was returning from Rumonge. His body was discovered the next day.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Development
NOTES: A member of the MSD was assaulted by police at a bar and then arrested. He was accused of blaming the police for the issues in his commune.
2 bodies suspected to be ex-FAB were discovered on Mutara colline.
2 dead bodies were found in the Siguvaye river.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 6 Imbonerakure beat a man, who died shortly after he made it to hospital. 3 of the Imbonerakure have been arrested.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: An Imbonerakure assaulted 2 children for playing near the CNDD-FDD monument.
Soldiers assaulted 5 men from Manga colline who were on their way to Viro Market in Rwanda. They beat the men with sticks and whips and detained them.
A former member of the public security police went out to buy fertiliser. His body was discovered on the banks of the Mubarazi River later in the day.
A shopkeeper was beaten to death by unidentified people. They looted nothing from his shop.
A young student was raped at gunpoint by a policeman.

The head of the police station and his transmission agent assaulted a trader. They accused the trader of having knocked them down, however, witnesses claim that the police simulated the accident in order to extort money from him.
A man who was accused of witchcraft was attacked by his neighbours. He died from his injuries.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
NOTES: A member of FRODEBU was assaulted by Imbonerakure. They accused him of spying on them.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: 30 people were beaten by the Burundian police when they arrived in Gisuru. They were part of a group of 80 Burundian refugees sent back from Tanzania by the Tanzanian police, who claim that they cannot stay in Tanzania because there is no war in Burundi.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
NOTES: The head of the National Intelligence Service assaulted a man. He later died in hospital
A policeman was beating a man for belonging to the wrong ethnic group. A woman tried to intervene, so he turned on her and beat her until she passed out.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: An FNL Rwasa motorcyclist was assaulted by 2 Imbonerakure and then arrested when he refused to buy beer for them.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: A member of FNL Rwasa was assaulted with a machete by men who he recognised as Imbonerakure. He was accused of refusing to contribute to the CNDD-FDD building projects.
A body was found on Nkehe hill.
A man was killed and his body dumped in the river Siguvyaye
The body of three people were found in Walubondo in the province of Cibitoke. The people had been shot dead.
A teenager was injured in a grenade attack.
Residents of Rukoba colline killed a man who they caught in the act of stealing a goat.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: An Imbonerakure was severely injured when he was attacked by 4 other Imbonerakure, who accused him of trying to usurp their authority.
Inhabitants beat a man to death when he was discovered stealing.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 3 young men were beaten by Imbonerakure who had demanded to know what they were talking about.
4 men in military uniform attempted to abduct a civilian. He realised what was happening and shouted for help. They shot and wounded him and then ran away.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: An Imbonerakure assaulted a shopkeeper.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure used cudgels to assault 3 young people who were out past the curfew time.
A woman was assaulted by her neighbours, who believe that she is a witch.
A man was attacked and beheaded by unknown assailants

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Development
NOTES: An MSD supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused him of being recalcitrant for not foining the ruling party.
An unidentified man was killed by a blow to the head. His body was found near Nyabitare.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: An UPRONA member was assaulted by Imbonerakure. They accused her of damaging a CNDD-FDD calendar.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
NOTES: A member of FRODEBU was arrested by Imbonerakure, who took him to the CNDD-FDD, where they ordered him to lie down and whipped him.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure sexually assaulted a teenage girl in the pasture behind her family home.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: When a man failed to buy an Imbonerakure a beer, he was beaten until he spit blood.
A guard was hit on the head and killed by unidentified assailants.
An ex FAB soldier who had travelled to Bujumbura to collect his allowance was abducted by an unknown group.
A woman's body was found in the Ruzira neighbourhood of Cankuzo. She is believed to have been killed by a soldier from the Mutukura Camp.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 20 Imbonerakure armed with clubs beat a man and a woman who they accused of making and selling a prohibited drink. The pair were then taken to the police station.

The University of Burundi authorities demanded to see the leaders of a proposed student strike individually at their offices. 170 students held a sit-in at the offices in solidarity with the student leaders.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
ALLY_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
NOTES: A senior FNL-Rwasa party organiser, who is also a senior official in the Burundian Revenue Office was arrested by the National Intelligence Service. He has disappeared.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who was visiting family in Saswe. They accused him of witchcraft.
14 people who are suspected of being rebels were arrested in Kazirabageni. They were tortured in custody by the local police and then transferred to the National Intelligence Services in Bujumbura.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure beat 4 men who they found during a patrol. They accused the men of being thieves
An UPRONA supporter was found dead on Murambi Hill. 8 people have been arrested.
An elected MP accused a child of stealing building materials from him. He tied up the child, hung him upside down, and whipped. When the child's mother arrived, he also whipped her.
A group of armed men in military uniforms invaded bars and beat the patrons in Muremera before heading to the Mashitsi Forest.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure held a protest in Matongo, where they sang songs to intimidate the opposition.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 2 Imbonerakure beat 2 men who they accused of being thieves.
A crowd of residents beat and stoned a man to death. He had been caught in the act of robbing an elderly woman.
Students at the Ecole Normale Superieure began a strike to protest a presidential decree about scholarships.
Students at the National University of Burundi began a strike to protest a presidential decree about scholarships.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
NOTES: A grenade was thrown at the house of an influential CNDD-FDD member. His wife was wounded in the attack.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: The area chief ordered Imbonerakure to assault a young woman who was arrested en route to join her husband in Tanzania
Police officers undressed and beat a man who crossed a police barrier.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
NOTES: A man accused of delivering secrets to a family member in Rwanda was arrested and tortured.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: A housekeeper was raped by Imbonerakure because her employer is a member of the FNL Rwasa movement.
A man was assaulted by the Chief of the Zone, who accused him of attempting to flee the country. The man died in custody.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who they accused of being a thief. He died from his wounds.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: 2 Imbonerakure assaulted a man who a senior member of the CNDD-FDD had accused of stealing a cellphone.
FNL forces entered a village and looted shops. The military confronted them and the forces fought from 2100h until 0400h. 4 people were abducted by the FNL, but 1 of them escaped.
An elderly woman was severely injured when a grenade was thrown in Mabanda. The motives for the attack are unknown.
A 52 year old man was hacked to death by a crowd wielding machetes when he was discovered in a potato field.
An unidentified armed group ambushed a transportation vehicle travelling to Gatumba. A woman was shot,  and 2 people were abducted.

A bus was attacked by an unidentified armed group. 2 people were injured and some passengers abducted. The authorities believe that the attack was carried out with the aim of kidnapping rather than killing passengers.
Unidentified armed men threw a grenade at people returning from work. 1 person was killed and 1 person was injured.
Armed men ambushed a bus in the Mutimbuzi commune. A woman was shot and wounded.
A man who was discovered to have been stealing a goat was beaten to death by inhabitants.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure beat a man in a bar because he was discussing the elections.
An NGO worker was killed and thrown under a vehicle in Musaga.

ACTOR2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
NOTES: The government has suspended opposition party MSD. The party is accused of using armed combat against the government.

A former CNDD-FDD Senator, Oscar Ntasano, who had quarrelled with senior officials was abducted. The car that took him has been discovered in a ditch in the north of the country. His family fears that he is dead.
Pro-government demonstrators gathered in Bujumbura to protest the granting of immunity to 2015 coup-plotters
After the Saturday Community Work a march was held to protest the granting of immunity to 2015 coup-plotters.
A young man was executed by Sergeant Major Gaspard Nimbona, who is notorious for having tortured and executed various activists since the beginning of the crisis.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure held a demonstration to protest the granting of immunity to 2015 coup-plotters
A man riding a motorbike threw a grenade through a car window in Kamenge. 1 person was killed and 4 were injured.
A man was strangled and dumped in Kizingwe.
Dead city strikes were called and well-attended in both of Cameroon's english-speaking regions. Bamenda and Buea were reportedly completely paralyzed by the strikes.
Dead city strikes were called and well-attended in both of Cameroon's english-speaking regions. Bamenda and Buea were reportedly completely paralyzed by the strikes.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram militants killed an RIB soldier in an attack in the Kolofata area.

2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed after detonating their bombs when confronted by vigilance committees members in the Double area of the Far North. One vigilance committee member was injured in the attack.
2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed in Kolofata as they attempted to target Cameroonian military forces. One died after detonating their bomb, while the other was killed by gunfire.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram fighters ambushed RIB soldiers, killing 3, in the Kolofata area. This followed a similar attack the day before.

Police opened fire on some youths in the city of Bamenda, who were protesting the alleged detention of some Anglophone labour leaders, resulting in serious injuries to 3. This occurred during a dead city strike related to ongoing labour strikes and calls for Anglophone independence. Looting was also reported in Bamenda during the incident, as well as a break-in at the Cameroonian election organizations premises in the city during which 3 vehicles were burned.
16 bodies were found in the Gnam-Gnam area. They are suspected to have been killed by Boko Haram.
Dead city protest strikes were called in Bamenda and Baeu after talks between the separatist regions ad the government broke down.
Dead city protest strikes were called in Bamenda and Baeu after talks between the separatist regions ad the government broke down.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CACSC: Cameroon Anglophone Civil Society Consortium
NOTES: A peaceful sit-in in Limbe called by the CACSC later turned into clashes between stone-throwing youths and tear gas firing by police/gendarmerie. 30 people were arrested. This occurred after youth started setting up barricades in the town.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CACSC: Cameroon Anglophone Civil Society Consortium
NOTES: Violent protests broke out in Buea after police arrested two leaders of the CACSC following the banning of the organization. Police used water cannons, tear gas and aerial gunfire to disperse the crowds. In some parts of the city youths built barricades and scuffled with police. There were also reports of vandalism against petrols stations and cars damaged.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: CACSC: Cameroon Anglophone Civil Society Consortium
NOTES: After recent unrest in Cameroon's Anglophone regions, the government has banned two labour organizations which have been organizing protests and strikes in the areas, the SCNC and CACSC.
Bamenda was again shut down by a dead city protest strike which was accompanied by a demonstrations, although there were no reports of violence.

SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Xinhua General News Service
NOTES: At least 3 people were killed and 4 others injured in a suicide attack by a suspected Boko Haram member in the Madana district of the city of Kousseri.
1 person was killed and 3 wounded in an attack by Boko Haram fighters on the Ouro-Moussa Kambo locality of Fotokol district.

At least 4 people were killed, including 3 bombers, in a suspected Boko Haram suicide attack at Double market in the Far North near the Nigerian border. Other sources estimated as many as 16 had died. Many of those injured were taken to Mora hospital.
One suicide bomber was shot by vigilance committee members and another self-detonated in Kerawa.

Dead city strikes were again called in Bamenda and Buea, and across Cameroon's two Anglopohne regions, despite negotiations between teachers unions and the governments to get students back to school and end the strikes.

Unidentified assailants allegedly used physical intimidation to prevent students from returning to classes during continued dead city strikes in Bamenda. Unidentified individuals also set fire to an administrative block in Bamenda during continued dead city strikes. A bus used by the bilingual Nitop high school was also vandalized.

Dead city strikes were again called in Bamenda and Buea, and across Cameroon's two Anglopohne regions, despite negotiations between teachers unions and the governments to get students back to school and end the strikes.
6 Cameroonian soldiers were injured in a clash with Boko Haram fighters at Gakara.
A French school was set on fire in the Ndop  during ongoing unrest in Cameroon's northwestern Anglophone region.
A dead city strike was called by protesters and largely adhered to in the city of Bamenda.

2 protesters were killed and 10 others injured when police opened fire on them as they tried to storm a police station in Ndop in Cameroon's northwestern Anglophone region. The protesters were demanding the release of those accused of setting a French school on fire. After the deaths, the protesters allegedly kidnapped the families of the area brigade commander and police commissioner and demanded the release of all detained youths from the area.

The Minister of Communications reported that at least 60 Boko Haram fighters were killed (4 fatalities reported in other events), a stronghold destroyed and a large stockpile of weapons seized during an offensive by Cameroonian army forces in the Mandara Mountains area since Jan.26. The minister also reported more than 5,000 people had been freed from captivity by Boko Haram. 20 suspected Boko Haram fighters were also arrested.
3 Cameroonian soldiers were killed when their vehicle hit a mine planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters at Gouzda Vreket in Mayo-Tsanaga.
The National Center for Youth and Sports Bamenda was the target of an attempted arson attack.
2 people were killed (including a bomber) and 2 wounded in a suicide attack by suspected Boko Haram militants in Amchide.
A villager was killed by Boko Haram fighters in the Waza area.
A "dead city" strike was well-attended in both of Cameroon's English-speaking regions, with Buea in particular reportedly entirely shut.
A "dead city" strike was well-attended in both of Cameroon's English-speaking regions, with Buea in particular reportedly entirely shut.
A "dead city" strike was well-attended in both of Cameroon's English-speaking regions, with Buea in particular reportedly entirely shut.
A villager was killed in the Madina neighbourhood of Fotokol by Boko Haram fighters.
2 suspected BK suicide bombers were killed by soldiers in the Boudoua area of Limani.
A suspected BK suicide bomber detonated themselves in the Magdeme area. No casualties were reported.
One person was killed and several wounded in an attack by Boko Haram on Goulouzivini village, near Wana.
4 army personnel were injured when a truck travelling between Zamga and Djibrili in the Mayo-Moskota area hit a landmine planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters .

SOURCE: L'Oeil du Sahel; Xinhua News Agency - French
NOTES: At least 3 Boko Haram militants were killed during an attack carried out on Cameroonian navy positions in Soueram area, near Ngouma. At least 2 Cameroonian military personnel were injured and taken to Kousseri for treatment. Other sources said as many as 9 were killed during the attack, mostly Boko Haram fighters.

Buea, Molyko, and other surrounding towns and villages in the Southwest Region staged a dead city strike to show solidarity with Anglohopne Civil Society Consortium leaders who are currently being tried by a military tribunal.

Buea, Molyko, and other surrounding towns and villages in the Southwest Region staged a dead city strike to show solidarity with Anglohopne Civil Society Consortium leaders who are currently being tried by a military tribunal.

Buea, Molyko, and other surrounding towns and villages in the Southwest Region staged a dead city strike to show solidarity with Anglohopne Civil Society Consortium leaders who are currently being tried by a military tribunal.
Teachers took to the streets in Yaounde, Maroua and Bambili to demand between 25-60 months of backpay, bonuses and promotions.
Teachers took to the streets in Yaounde, Maroua and Bambili to demand between 25-60 months of backpay, bonuses and promotions.
Teachers took to the streets in Yaounde, Maroua and Bambili to demand between 25-60 months of backpay, bonuses and promotions.
A market in Limbe was attaced by arsonists. The govenrment accuses secessionist groups of being behind the attack.

SOURCE: L'Oeil du Sahel; Xinhua News Agency - French
NOTES: 2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers set off their explosives at the entrance to Mora, near a technical high school. No other casualties were reported.
A suicide bombing by a suspected Boko Haram bomber resulted in one killed and many wounded in Kolofata.
At least 4 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters in an attack on the locality of Ganei.
At least 2 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters during an attack in Sandawadjiri.
Hundreds of youths in Bamenda marched on the Cameroonian Ministry of Posts and Telecomms to demand the re-instatement of internet for Cameroon's English-speaking regions.
A suicide bomber on a bicycle killed a constable and 2 civilians in an attack in Kolofata. 4 others were injured.
Suspected Boko Haram fighters killed one person and abducted 3 girls in Mbereche, near Limani.
Ex-employees of state companies staged a sit-in outside the Ministry of Finance in Yaounde to demand their rights.
3 Cameroonian soldiers were killed and 5 wounded when their truck hit a landmine planted by suspected Boko Haram militants as it passed between Homeka and Bladole in Mora district.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
NOTES: One civilian was killed and 35 other injured, as well as 7 BIR soldiers, during an attack by Boko Haram militants on Ndaba in the Kolofata area. Several militants were also killed (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
4 members of a vigilance committee from Achigachia were killed during clashes with Boko Haram.
A suicide bombing was reported in the Chakarmari area. The bomber was killed and one civilian was injured.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
NOTES: UPC fighters forced FPRC fighters out of Piangou village where they had been based for several days.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
NOTES: The UPC took control of Bakala from the FPRC. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: The UPC "quickly started to kill civilians" on the same day that they took Bakala from the FPRC. At least 2 civilians were reported killed by witnesses.

ACTOR1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
ACTOR2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; Reseau des Journalistes de RCA
NOTES: Residents of Bakala say at least 186 people were killed during clashes between the FPRC and UPC between Dec.11-12. It is not clear how many were combatants or civilians, or if civilians were targeted specifically during the fighting.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: UPC fighters executed 25 civilians at a school in Bakala after they took the town earlier in the week. The same day UPC fighters also killed 7 people as they returned from a nearby gold mine. They accused those killed of having supported Anti-Balaka forces.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: At least 10 civilians were reported killed in a UPC attack on Yambele, southeast of Bambari, by HRW.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Maghreb Emergent (French); AFP -- English; Réseau des Journalistes de RCA
NOTES: 2 Moroccan peacekeepers were killed in an attack by unidentified gunmen on a MINUSCA convoy traveling in the Mboki area. 2 soldiers were also injured.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA fighters were attacked in the Bocaranga area by Anti-Balaka fighters, resulting in at least one Bangladeshi peacekeeper killed. RRR forces were also reported in the area, but it was not clear if they participated in the event.

Clashes were reported in the Ouham-Pende localities of Pende and Santouwane between RRR and Anti-Balaka fighters. As many as 6 RRR fighters were killed in these clashes, and 2 Anti-Balaka fighters seriously injured.

ACTOR1: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
NOTES: Women whose husbands are part of the former Seleka coalition have been attacked recently by MPC members in Kaga Bandoro. The MPC are allegedly looking for information on their relatives who are fighters.

A woman was attacked by a group of youth in Berberati after being accused of being a witch and involved in the death of a young man in a hunting accident. MINUSCA forces intervened and saved the woman.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: UPC fighters have allegedly set up a base in Ngola.

Suspected LRA forces attacked Gambatoure, CAR. They were armed with AK type weapons, and dressed in military and civilian clothing. The group consisted of men, women and children.They looted food and communications equipment from the community.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: A man and his two children were killed by UPC fighters in Mourouba, near Bakala.

Suspected LRA forces attacked a pastoralist camp near Yangou Brindi, CAR, killing 3 cows and taking the meat. The group was comprised of men, women, and children. The men were armed with AK-type weapons and wore a mix of civilian and military clothing.
Taxi and bus drivers engaged in a work stoppage over harassment by the police.

Suspected Anti-Balaka fighters shot some civilians in Bozoum after the local MINUSCA contingent withdrew from the city over allegations of trading in liquor. The base was looted soon after the contingent left by suspected Anti-Balaka fighters as well.
2 Ugandan soldiers were killed by suspected LRA fighters who ambushed them in Kitife village in the Zemio area. Several civilians were also wounded during the ambush.
LRA fighters abducted 3 civilians northwest of Mboki. One of the hostages was given money to buy supplies in return for the release of the other two.
Anti-Balaka fighters ambushed a vehicle near Bozoum and robbed its passengers.
SOCATEL employees renewed their strike after 8 days without resolution of their grievances. They are demanding the payment of wage arrears.
Young people who accused a woman of witchcraft in the Bougoumara area near Batangafo buried her alive.

LRA forces attacked 3 traders 10 km from Mboki, CAR. The assailants wore a mix of civilian and military clothing, and were armed with AK-type weapons. They spoke Sango, Acholi, and Zande. A trader was looted of cassava and meat.

6 suspected LRA forces including 2 men and 4 boys of less than 18, attacked a camp in a field north of Mboki, CAR. They looted peanuts, cassava, a motorbike battery, and palm wine. They abducted 3 people and forced them to porter the looted goods.

Suspected LRA forces attacked the mining camp of Gbodio, 7 km south of Malacha in Haute-Kotto, CAR. The assailants were armed with AK-type weapons, and wore a mix of civilian and military clothing. They looted food and non-food items from the mining camp.

Suspected LRA forces attacked a pastoralist camp near Zemio, CAR. The group of assailants was comprised of men, women and children. Some of the men were armed, and wore a mix of civilian and military clothing. They killed a number of cows.
A group of young Anti-Balaka members attempted to set fire to the house of a man and lynch him for allegedly causing the death of a deputy in Damara using "sorcery". The man escaped unharmed.

A large group of suspected LRA forces attacked a motorcyclist on his way to Zemio, CAR, from Banangui, CAR. The group of assailants was comprised of men, women, and children. They asked the man for food and temporarily held him captive.

A large number of former Seleka fighters from several groups have been gathering in Bambari recently, causing concern among the population and administration of the city. The UN also warned the former Seleka groups against any conflict around the city which is a major aid distribution point.

Suspected LRA forces attacked a cyclist on his way to Mboki from Obo, CAR. The assailants wore a mix of civilian and military clothing, they had AK-type weapons, and spoke Acholi and Sango. They looted all of his belongings as well as a bag of sugar.
Suspected LRA forces held 3 women captive overnight near the community of Bahr, CAR.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA forces have been drawn in from smaller bases and redeployed around Bambari after recent fighting between different ex-Seleka factions and fears of an impending attack on the town.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: Clashes were reported between UPC and Anti-Balaka fighters in Ngaboko. At least one Anti-Balaka leader was killed and another seriously injured, while at least 2 civilians were reportedly left in comas afer the fighting.

RRR fighters attacked Bocaranga in the early morning on Feb.3, firing into the air to scare the population before looting several shops and vandalizing a church. At least 50 people took refuge at the local MONUSCA camp. At least 10 people were reported killed in the attack. Both the Danish Refugee Council and IRC were allegedly looted during the attack.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA forces intervened in a clash between Anti-Balaka and 3R fighters in Bocaranga, opening fire on both sides to end the fighting.

15 people were killed in clashes in and around Bocaranga between 3R and Anti-Balaka fighters. Some casualties were reported among the town's civilians, and many people were displaced. MINUSCA forces intervened in a clash between Anti-Balaka and 3R fighters in Bocaranga, opening fire on both sides to end the fighting.

ACTOR2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
