A church in Gbadolite district and another at Katuba-Upemba in the Lubumbashi area were also attacked. These attacks were primarily reported in Haut-Katanga. 4 people were arrested in connection. The incidents are believed to be related to the national political transition agreement.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Kamwina Nsapu militiamen clashed with Congolese forces in the Nganza commune of Kananga. No injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 people, a nurse and a Batwa militiamen, were killed in a recent clash between Bantu and Batwa ethnic militias in the Tundwa area near Kalemie. 60 other people were also wounded.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 5 people were kidnapped from their farms in Kibende. The culprits were suspected to be members of armed groups operating in the area.
A suspected LRA group ambushed 2 motorcyclists and 1 cyclist west of Banda, DRC. The assailants looted the victims of all their belongings.

ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Batwa and Bantu in the Kalemie area signed a non-aggression pact in the context of recent ethnic violence between the two groups.
Nurses in Tanganyika protested and announced a minimum service strike until their colleague, who was killed during a Batwa militia attack, has been buried.
Teachers of public schools in Isiro and its surroundings have gone on strike to protest non-payment of wages.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 4 artisanal miners were injured after police allegedly opened fire on their protest in Mongbwalu. The miners were protesting after being removed from an area where gold was recently found.
6 artisanal miners were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki militiamen in the Kabare area.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and security forces in Kananga town.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and security forces in the town of Nganza.
A suspected LRA group looted 3 households during the night near Banda, DRC. The assailants reportedly asked where young boys were as they looted rice, corn, clothes, and money from the households.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: The bodyguard of an MLA got into a confrontation with some motorcyclye taxi drivers blocking a road in Bunia. The bodyguard fired into the crowd, severely injuring one person. The person later died in hsopital.
Teachers in South Kivu went on strike and staged a protest march to the Provincial Ministry of Education in Bukavu. The protest was over potential layoffs and pay.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes erupted in Bunia between police and protesting motorcycle taxi drviers after a driver shot the day before by an MLA died in hospital. The police used tear gas to attempt to disperse the taxi drivers.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A police guard of the provincial minister in charge of the environment beat an environmental inspector at the Masako Reserve, 15km north of Kisangani. The inspector was attempting to seize allegedly illegal obtained goods.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 7 employees of a Canadian mining company (Banro), including four Congolese, two Tanzanians, and one French national, were kidnapped by unidentified assailants in the Namoya area of Maniema.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 3 police have been killed in attacks by unidentified militiamen on voter registration centres in the Nyamilima, Nyanzale and Birundule localities of Rutshuru (fatalities coded across 3 events). The continuing insecurity in the area has caused CENI to close other registration centres.
Currency traders in Bukavu declared a 7-day strike to protest against the recent murder of money changers in their area.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 3 bodies were found in a communal grave in the Buleusa area by a soldier. One of the bodies was that of a relative of the governor of North Kivu. The bodies had their hands and feet tied.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 3 police have been killed in attacks by unidentified militiamen on voter registration centres in the Nyamilima, Nyanzale and Birundule localities of Rutshuru (fatalities coded across 3 events). The continuing insecurity in the area has caused CENI to close other registration centres.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 3 police have been killed in attacks by unidentified militiamen on voter registration centres in the Nyamilima, Nyanzale and Birundule localities of Rutshuru (fatalities coded across 3 events). The continuing insecurity in the area has caused CENI to close other registration centres.

5 LRA forces ambushed 7 civilians, one after the other, 11km west of Banda, DRC. One of the victims was able to escape while the other 6 (2 women and 4 men) were forced to shell nuts all night. LRA forces also abducted a woman 13 km west of Banda, DRC, while she was on her way to her field with her husband.
Transport and Ports Corporation (SCTP) employees organized a sit-in outside the administrative building to request payment of four months' salary arrears.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A police officer and 3 members of the BDK were killed in an operation in the Ma Campagne area of Kinshasa which resulted in the arrest of the leader and "guru" of the BDK.

Students from the Higher Institute of Agricultural Studies, Yatolema, protested against illegal barriers erected in their area. They broke one such barrier and set fire to a checkpost of the security forces in the area.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: An Uruguayan MONUSCO peacekeeper was shot and injured by unidentified assailants in the Kasai-Central region.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: The body of a senior police official was found in the Dibelenge area. He is suspected to have been killed by Kamwina Nsapu militiamen.
A dozen LUCHA activists protested and staged a sit-in outside the governor's office to demand provincial authorities take steps to lower the price of corn.
Suspected LRA forces attacked the community of Disolo, DRC, and looted a person involved in the local school, stealing the salary of the teachers, and looted the health center.

ACTOR1: Bangubangu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 7 employees of a mining company were kidnapped by a group composed of members of the Bangu Bangu ethnic group in the Salambila area of Kabambare territory. Foreign nationals were among those kidnapped.

2 people were allegedly abducted by Angolan security forces from Kai-Nganga village in the Lukula area. They were suspected of searching for FLEC militants who had crossed the border. At least one of those taken was injured by gunfire first.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Two days of clashes between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and police were reported in Kananga. On the second day, a convent was ransacked although no injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A new wave of IDPs has been reported fleeing clashes between the Batwa and Bantu ethnic groups in southeastern DR-Congo.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: One person was killed in clashes between Congolese security forces and Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Nyamutiri area of Uvira.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Two days of clashes between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and police were reported in Kananga. On the second day, a convent was ransacked although no injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
SOURCE: International Freedom of Expression Exchange Clearing House
NOTES: 2 journalists were seriously wounded by shrapnel from a grenade allegedly thrown by a police officer while they were covering a protest by residents of Kindu who were demanding to be allowed to stone two alleged thieves. The journalists were standing apart from the crowd and were reportedly directly targeted.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
SOURCE: International Freedom of Expression Exchange Clearing House
NOTES: Residents of Kindu protested and demanded to be allowed to stone two alleged thieves captured in the area. Police used tear gas to disperse the demonstrators.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 7 Simba Mayi Mayi militiamen were killed in a clash with Congolese soldiers in the Muchacha area of Mambasa territory.
A suspected LRA group looted the community of Bandueli, DRC. They looted food and non-food items between 03:00 and 06:00. Security forces were sent to investigate the incident.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Police fired into the air to disperse a protest by motorcycle taxi drivers. The drivers were protesting the death of a colleague after being hit by a police vehicle.
Mayi Mayi militiamen allegedly stole at least 50 fishing boats between Mar.9-13 from fishermen on Lake Edward.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 18 Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and 2 police were reported killed in a clash in the Mwene Ditu area. Another police officer was seriously wounded, as well as several civilians.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported in Mwene Ditu between as many as 300 Kamwina Nsapu militiamen who had previously entered the locality and security forces. The clashes lasted between Mar.11-12. No injuries were reported but at least 3 militiamen were arrested. Several people (coded as 3 across 2 events) were killed over the course of the weekend.

6 suspected LRA forces looted 4 motorcyclists on their way Banda, DRC. The assailants spoke Acholi, poor Lingala, and Swahili, they wore a mix of civilian and military clothing, and were armed with 5 AK-type weapons and a machete.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported in Mwene Ditu between as many as 300 Kamwina Nsapu militiamen who had previously entered the locality and security forces. The clashes lasted between Mar.11-12. No injuries were reported but at least 3 militiamen were arrested. Several people (coded as 3 across 2 events) were killed over the course of the weekend.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 UN employees, an American and a Swede, and 4 DR-Congo nationals were abducted by unidentified assailants on Tshimbulu Rd near a bridge over the Moyo River in Kasai-Central.
Kamwina Nsapu fighters burned and looted several administrative offices and those of INEC in Kazumba.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Security forces fired shots to disperse Kamwina Nsapu militiamen who were reportedly advancing on the Kananga city centre from several communes of the city, including Kamayi Saint Alphonse, the Pax roundabout, SNEL district and Nganza commune.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 3 people were killed during clashes between Mayi Mayi militiamen and security forces in the Upemba National Park area.

ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 15 FDLR fighters, including those of Rwandan, Burundian and Congolese nationality, surrendered without their weapons to MONUSCO authorities based in Kanyabayonga in Lubero territory.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Kamwina Nsapu fighters and police clashed in the Nganza area of Kasai Central. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: At least 8 mass graves have been discovered around Tshimbulu (reported Mar.20) in the context of ongoing fighting between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and security forces in the area. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

As many as 200 bodies were reported to have been discovered in the Luiza area by local authorities who believe they are victims of violence allegedly carried out by the KN militia. The bodies were discovered over the last two months (reported Apr.14).

ACTOR1: Ifiti Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Bolambi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: One person was killed and 10 houses burned during a land dispute between the Ifiti and Bolambi villages in Isangi territory.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A police officer was killed and 2 others injured in the Kiziba II area of Nyiragongo area of North Kivu by about two dozen unidentified gunmen.
The Veranda Muchanga youth association declared a dead-city strike in Butembo on the anniversary of the assassination of a priest from the Bunyuka parish.

ACTOR1: Lodjo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Lodjo community members attacked Tchuru village and burned some huts over a land dispute.

ACTOR1: Lodjo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Tchuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Tchuru community members attacked Lodjo village in retaliation for an attack on their village, burning 2 schools and clashing with the residents, resulting in one killed.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 civilians were killed by unidentified assailants in the Kikuku area of North Kivu. On the same day 3 bodies were also found killed by knives in their fields in the area. Local militiamen were suspected in the killings.
2 vehicles carrying corn were burned in the Katuba commune of Lubumbashi by protesters angry over rising maize prices in the city.
Youths demonstrated in Mahagi after the bodies of two motorcycle taxi drivers were found. The youths burned tires and barricaded roads to denounce the killings.

ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 18 people were killed during an attack by Bantu militiamen on the Batwa commune of Mutiba in the Manono area. 11 of those killed were Bantu and 7 Batwa.
Kamwina Nsapu militiamen were reported to be in control of several towns in the Luilu area of Lomani. An MP from the area also claimed they have engaged in killings (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: The body of a resident of Mapanda was found in the Bendera area. This is believed to have motivated the killing of the traditional chief of Kanambe a few days later.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: At least 42 police were reportedly decapitated by Kamwina Nsapu militiamen during an ambush on their convoy between Tshikapa and Kananga.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A Congolese soldier and 3 Mayi Mayi militiamen were killed in a clash in the Kalau suburb of Beni. The Mayi Mayi militiamen burned some houses before being driven off. 2 soldiers were also injured and 6 militiamen captured.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 youths were killed by a landmine explosion in the Gokpa area of Djugu. A third was severely injured and taken to hospital.
Displaced people arriving in Kibirizi reported that they were fleeing an attack by Nyatura fighters on Kishishe in the Bwito chieftancy near Rutshuru.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: At least one militia member was killed during a clash between as many as 100 Kamwina Nsapu fighters and Congolese soldiers in Tshimbulu. MONUSCO forces were deployed to reinforce the Congolese soldiers and also came under fire.
Nurses at the General Hospital Dipumba in Mbuji Mayi started a strike to demand the release of their colleague who was detained following the death of a doctor.

ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked an election registration centre in Aveba but were repulsed by Congolese security forces.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen killed the traditional chief of Kanambe (a Batwa community) and 4 members of his family in the Bendera area of Tanganyika. This took place 4 days after the discovery of the body of a resident of nearby Mapanda village.

ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: FRPI militiamen raided an INEC camp in the Kagaba area and kidnapped a data entry operator.

ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: FRPI militiamen clashed with Congolese soldiers and stole election-related materials from a registration centre in Kamatsi.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 18 Kamwina Nsapu militiamen were killed in a clash with Congolese soldiers in the Kambamba area of Lualaba. 3 militiamen were also captured.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Angry youth erected barricades and clashed with police who attempted to remove them following the breakdown in negotiations between the government and opposition over elections and transition.

ACTOR1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
NOTES: 8 APCLS soldiers were killed during clashes with the FDC in the Nyamaboko area of Masisi.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: The bodies of 2 missing UN Group of Experts members, one Swedish and the other American, and their Congolese interpreter were found dead in the Moyo River area of Kasai-Central.
16 people, mostly farmers, were abducted and later released by suspected Burundian rebels in the Kiliba area.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Youths erected barricades using burned tires and stones to protest in different neighbourhoods of Lubumbashi over the breakdown of negotiations to solve the political situation. Police backed by Congolese soldiers dispersed the protesters in different places. One polcie officer was reported wounded in the incidents, while the office of the National Insurance Company was set on fire in the Kampemba area.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: The Diocesan Commission for Social Communications of Kananga and displaced people from the area claim that security forces in Nganza have engaged in killings and extortion in relation to hunting down Kamwina Nsapu militia fighters. Later reports by rights groups assert that 40 civilians were killed during the sweeps.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 17 new mass graves were discovered by UN investigators in the areas where the conflict between security forces and Kamwina Nsapu militiamen has been ongoing. 15 of these were found in Tshimbulu, while 2 were found in the Kienke area, while all date back to Mar.26-30 (reported on Apr.21).  UN high commissioner for human rights accused the army of killing those in the graves. At least 74 bodies attributed to the military's operations (1 fatality already covered by battles in the area).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 17 new mass graves were discovered by UN investigators in the areas where the conflict between security forces and Kamwina Nsapu militiamen has been ongoing. 15 of these were found in Tshimbulu, while 2 were found in the Kienke area, while all date back to Mar.26-30 (reported on Apr.21).  UN high commissioner for human rights accused the army of killing those in the graves. At least 74 bodies attributed to the military's operations (1 fatality already covered by battles in the area).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Gunfire heard in Kananga overnight was reported to be clashes between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and police. One person was reported killed.
2 transporters were abducted from Nyakabere by local militiamen. A ransom was demanded for their release.
A customs strike was declared in Uvira, paralyzing cross-border activity, by customs agents over an alleged tax proposed by the Congolese Control Office of Uvira.
Civilians working in their fields in Lubarika were beaten and robbed by suspected Burundian rebels.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: At least one civilian was killed during a clash between Congolese soldiers and NDC-R/Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen during which the army retook Kasuho village in Lubero.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Suspected Kamwina Nsapu militiamen took control of Luebo, killing at least 8 people including police. They looted and set fire to various administrative and religious buildings.

Kamwina Nsapu militiamen took control of Luebo and burned public buildings, including the CENI offices, and those beloning to the Catholic church, including a local convent. At least 8 people were reported killed, and at least one person's body was mutilated, during the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 8 local militia fighters, including their leader, Kivuwe Songa, from the Bafuliiru highlands near Uvira surrendered to FARDC soldiers.
More than 70 CENI agents started a strike in Ituri to demand their risk premiums.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A local human rights activists in Kananga has claimed that between 100-148 people were targeted for extrajudicial killings by security forces during search operations for Kamwina Nsapu militia members in the area. As many as 200 were allegedly also reported missing. Other by media and NGO groups seem to back up these claims, although exact casualties remain uncertain.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported in the Luebo and Tshimbulu areas between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and security forces.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and security forces have been ongoing for more than a week in Nganza (reported on Apr.7).

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported in the Luebo and Tshimbulu areas between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and security forces. Fatalities were reported in Tshimbulu (unknown number coded as 10).

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
NOTES: A countrywide strike was called by the OCR over the breakdown of the political transition deal. The strike was reportedly attended in Kinshasa, Goma, Kananga, Mbuji-Mayi and Lubumbashi.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
NOTES: A countrywide strike was called by the OCR over the breakdown of the political transition deal. The strike was reportedly attended in Kinshasa, Goma, Kananga, Mbuji-Mayi and Lubumbashi.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
NOTES: A countrywide strike was called by the OCR over the breakdown of the political transition deal. The strike was reportedly attended in Kinshasa, Goma and Lubumbashi.

NOTES: A countrywide strike was called by the OCR over the breakdown of the political transition deal. The strike was reportedly attended in Kinshasa, Goma, Kananga, Mbuji-Mayi and Lubumbashi.

NOTES: A countrywide strike was called by the OCR over the breakdown of the political transition deal. The strike was reportedly attended in Kinshasa, Goma, Kananga, Mbuji-Mayi and Lubumbashi.

NOTES: A countrywide strike was called by the OCR over the breakdown of the political transition deal. The strike was reportedly attended in Kinshasa, Goma, Kananga, Mbuji-Mayi and Lubumbashi.

ACTOR1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: At least one member of the Bantu ethnic group was killed and 20 wounded in an attack by Batwa in the Fulero area in Kabambare. At least 12 houses were also torched.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: The UN has announced the discovery of 13 new mass graves in central Congo, bringing the total found since the beginning of the Kamwina Nsapu rebellion to 23 (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

ACTOR1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: After a member of the Nande ethnic group was killed in the Kishishe area of Ruthsuru, Nande youth attacked a Hutu community, burning several houses and killing at least one person.

ACTOR1: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: The body of a member of the Nande ethnic group  in the Kishishe area of Rutshuru after he was kidnapped and killed by a suspected Hutu militia.

ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Following a Nande attack on the Hutu community in Kishishe in Rutshuru, FDLR-Nyatura coalition fighters attacked the Nande community, killing 3.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: At least 4 people were killed, including a police officer and 3 civilians, during clashes between residents near Kapolowe in the Kambove area and security forces which started over alleged extortion by the members of the security forces.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes between Kamwina Nsapu militiamen and security forces have been ongoing for more than a week in Nganza (reported on Apr.7).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A pastor was found dead near a railway in Kapolowe. This allegedly had a part to play in clashes between residents of the area and security forces over the following week.

ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
NOTES: At least 9 people were killed during ethnic violence in the Bwito chiefdom, including attacks by FDLR-Nyatura militiamen on civilians (5 fatalities coded in other events).

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Kamwina Nsapu militiamen clashed with security forces in the Nganza area. No casualties were reported.

A hospital, a convent, and a Catholic parish were vandalized and ransacked by Kamwina Nsapu militiamen in the Kalamb area of Kapanga territory. No clashes with security forces or casualties were reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Police dispersed a rally of nearly 300 UDPS activists in the Limete commune. The UPDS activists were protesting over the appointment of the new PM.
Kamwina Nsapu militiamen advanced on Mweka allegedly without opposition and burned administrative and police buildings.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A journalist was abducted by men in civilian clothes in Lubumbashi.

ACTOR2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 40 Kamwina Nsapu militiamen surrendered to the provincial authorities in Kananga City.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: At least 16 KN fighters were reported killed and some wounded by Congolese soldiers in Kalamba town in Kapanga territory. No other casualties were reported.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: At least 7 KN fighters were reported killed in fighting with police forces in Kamonia.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A dead city protest strike was called in Beni by the OCR. Some demonstrators also attempted a march but were dispersed by police who used tear gas.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A group of OCR activists marching in Bunia was surrounded and detained by police.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition; UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: At least 4 people were arrested during a march organized by the OCR in Kamina. All 4 were members of the UDPS. The police allege that the protesters were violent and injured at least 3 police. Police also used tear gas and allegedly fired live ammo to disperse the protesters.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
NOTES: Kananga and Kinshasa witnessed "dead city" protest strikes called by the OCR without demonstrations in the face of a protest ban.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 10 activists of various OCR member-parties were arrested as they began a march in Kindu.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
NOTES: Kananga and Kinshasa witnessed "dead city" protest strikes called by the OCR without demonstrations in the face of a protest ban.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 7 OCR activists were arrested while demonstrating in Kongolo against the breakdown of the political transition deal. Clashes were also reported, with at least 5 five police injured in stone-throwing.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A march organized by the OCR in Lubumbashi was dispersed by police, who arrested at least 28 people.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Protests organized by the OCR were reportedly dispersed by police in Mbandaka. Some people were detained but no arrests were reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported in Mbuji Mayi between people engaged in a march organized by the OCR and police. No injuries reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A protest in Bukavu organized by the OCR was dispersed by police with some injuries reported.
A cattle trader was killed allegedly by Kifuafua Mayi Mayi militiamen at Chambucha in Walikale territory.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 3 CENI agents were arrested as they staged a sit-in with their colleagues to demand promised payment related to training and relocation.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: At least 18 people were killed on Tuesday, April 11 during clashes between police and Kamwina Nsapu militiamen in Dimbelenge.
5 people, including civilians, were killed during clashes between different Mayi Mayi militias in the Bijombo area, specifically around the villages of Tshanzovu and Murambya.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Clashes were reported between KN fighters and police in Kamiji territory, where the police commander was reportedly beheaded. Police also allegedly killed some KN fighters during the encounters (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: LUCHA activists protested outside the Central Bank office in Goma to demand better management of microfinancing. The demonstration was dispersed by police who arrested 30 activists before later releasing them.

ACTOR1: Pende Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ALLY_ACTOR_1: Tshokwe Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Luba people in villages around Tshikapa claimed that Pende and Tshokwe peoples set fire to many of their homes. These arsons were reported in the villages of Kamako, Samba, Tukondo, and Kabunga Kamonia.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Police allegedly assaulted 3 journalists covering a LUCHA protest in Goma.

ACTOR2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 50 youth fighters of the KN militia (between 14-17 years old) surrendered to the government and were presented to MONUSCO/UNICEF in Kananga on Apr.14.
KN fighters killed 4 civilians and burned a vehicle in the Kananga area as they were traveling from Dimbelenge territory.

ACTOR2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: A new group of surrendered Kamwina Nsapu militiamen (exact number not reported) were presented at a ceremony in Kananga by the Minister of the Interiror/Security/Public Order.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: More than 500 youths fled from villages neighbouring Mwene-Ditu following an alleged forceful recruitment drive by the army in the area.

Some students at the University of Kinshasa taking an exam rioted and ransacked the room they were in as they believed they had not been given enough time. At least one person was injured during the incident.

SOURCE: International Freedom of Expression Exchange Clearing House
NOTES: JED reported that a community radio station was set on fire in Mayi-Munene near Tshikapa by a group of Kamwina Nsapu militiamen.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: 2 prisoners were killed during a riot at a prison in Bulungu. This resulted in later protests by Bulungu residents.
Residents of Bulungu protested outside the prosecutor's office over the death of two detainees in a riot at a nearby prison.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Congolese soldiers clashed with 2 Mayi Mayi militias in the Kalonga/Kalau area, resulting in a soldier and 2 militiamen killed.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; AFP -- English; Radio Okapi
NOTES: 16 civilian UN staff of MONUSCO were taken hostage for several hours by about 530 former South Sudanese rebels at the Munigi camp outside Goma. The rebels were demanding the creation of a third country for South Sudanese opposition forces to inhabit. The staff were later released without any injuries reported.
The Doctors' Order and the National Union of Physicians of North Kivu organized a protest involving health professionals and residents of Bukavu to denounce the recent killing of a gynecologist.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Seventeen LUCHA activists who were trying to organize a sit-in outside the local headquarters of the Central Bank of Congo (BCC) were arrested Wednesday in Goma in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo.
