NOTES: At least 21 fighters of the Libyan National Army (LNA), loyal to commander Khalifa Haftar, were killed in clashes with Islamic State militants in the northern Al-Sabri neighbourhood and Qanfuda area of the eastern city of Benghazi on 5 January. A column of vehicles is reported to have bust out of Ganfouda and headed south towards Suluq. They are said to have included Wissam Ben Humaid, the militants leader. Fatalities divided between events.
Explosive devices were reportedly discovered in a school near the passport centre in Al-Majuri, Benghazi.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: 13 militants, all thought to have taken part in yesterdays Ganfouda breakout, were taken to Ajdbiya hospital after blowing themselves up on 6 January when they were surrounded by LNA forces at the village of Saunau east of Ajdabiya. Two soldiers died and four wounded in fighting with militants in Saunnu to the east of Ajdabiya not far from the B11 inland highway linking the town to Tobruk.

Unconfirmed reports not far from Zawia of at least two incidents of smugglers fuel tanker trucks on their way to the border being shot at or destroyed by vigilante militias. The vigilante militias have declared that they will be mounting an operation against fuel smugglers.

Protestors, believed to be fuel smugglers, have shut down the fuel pipeline feeding GECOLs power plant in Zawia. This move follows the accusations from the NOC's chairman of domestic and international fuel smuggling against the Western Petroleum Facilities Guards (PFG) Nasr brigade who withdrew from the refinery. The pipeline belongs to the Sirte Oil and Gas Company and is located in the Bir Tirfas area near Bani Walid, south of the capital Tripoli.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: The Libya National Army arrested Mustafa Al-Sohaibi (Abu Alzubir Al-Ansari, the Ansar Al-Sharia commander who had held Benghazis Gwarsha Gate until the LNA wrested it from militant control last November) on 9 January near Jalu.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Protesters stormed the Al Madar mobile phone company headquarters in the Sidi Masri district of Tripoli as a counter move to what they say is criminally instigated power cuts forced on the capital.
A Man-made River water reservoir supplying the capital was vandalised at the Bir Tirfas area near Bani Walid, cutting water to the beleaguered capital.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: One member of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shoura Council was killed in fighting against the Libyan National Army in Benghazi.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The head of the self-proclaimed government affiliated to the Tripoli-based defunct parliament, the General National Congress, declared that he had officially taken control of buildings belonging to the UN-backed Government of National Accord (GNA) and that the political solution signed in Skhirat, Morocco in December 2015 and under which the GNA was formed was null and void. Militiamen backing Khalifa Ghwell and his resurrected Government of National Salvation attacked the ministries of Defence, Labour and Martyrs Families, Wounded and the Missing. A GNA spokesman denied the reports, saying that attempts to take the buildings had failed. The GNA's Presidency Council said following an emergency meeting that it had deployed army units in the capital to reinstate security in the capital and repel attempts to seize government buildings.

ACTOR1: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A breakaway group of HoR members who fully support the Libyan Political Agreement (LPA) and its Presidency Council and Government of National Accord (PC/GNA), opened a Tripoli branch of the HoR. Pro-GNA members took over the tourism ministry headquarters by the port, putting up a notice that it was now the HoR headquarters, based in Tripoli. The move was apparently sanctioned by Deputy Presidency Council member from Misrata, Ahmed Maetig. The House of Representatives (HoR) in Tobruk condemned the move.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A number of Tourism Ministry employees organized a small protest outside the building after members of the House of Representatives (HoR) set up a branch of the HoR in Tripoli. They objected to a banner being put up, protesting the takeover of their building.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Eight fighters of the Libyan National Army (LNA) were killed and 19 others injured in clashes in Qanfuda and Al-Sabri, north-west of Benghazi. Fatalities split between two events.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Eight fighters of the Libyan National Army (LNA) were killed and 19 others injured in clashes in Qanfuda and Al-Sabri, north-west of Benghazi. Fatalities split between two events.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: An Islamist commander is reported to have died in an assault on the Ganfouda militant enclave in Benghazi. The Islamist was reported to be a commander in the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shoura Council and by another as an Ansar Al-Sharia leader. He was wounded by shrapnel on 13 January in an air strike and is said to have died on 14 January.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Two members of the Saiqa Special Forces were killed in fighting in the Ganfouda district of Benghazi and others injured. Airstrikes were also reported. The LNA is claiming that it has occupied more areas of Ganfouda squeezing the militants into a yet smaller area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: A commander in the LNA's special forces was killed in clashes that erupted on Saturday, 14 January in the western neighbourhood of Qanfuda as the militia coalition, the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC), tried to advance on its rival's position in the area.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The largely Amazigh 12th Brigade, which also calls itself the Hay Andalus Defence Operations Room, set up sand barriers and checkpoints from Hay Andalus to Ghut Shaal, Serraj and Janzur and are said to be arresting anyone from Suq Al-Juma, in an attempt to to try to force the release of their commander, Adel Sifau who was arrested by Rada ("Deterrence") forces.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: A Libyan National Army MiG conducted an air raid targeting MSCD on the outskirts of Derna.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Four members of the Saiqa Special forces, including an unnamed field commander, died on 15 January in fighting in Ganfouda.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: A Libyan air force Mig 23 crashed in Benghazi during an airstrike on Ganfouda. The pilot and company-pilot ejected safely. A Libyan National Army spokesman said the warplane had suffered a technical failure whilst AFP reported that it was targeted by a missile and shot down. The spokesman denied an earlier report credited to a LNA commander that the aircraft had been hit by ground fire.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: The LNA said that it had now taken the last part of Busnaib, an area of largely open ground to the east of the Ganfouda district where the remaining militants are trapped.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: At least one boat that was reportedly attempting to deliver supplies to Derna was hit outside the port by a navy craft manned by the LNA. There are some reports claiming that, in fact, four vessels were involved, that they came from Misrata, that two were hit and two escaped.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: The Libyan National Army found six imprisoned former members of Qaddafis army when they took a building in street fighting in Ganfouda, Benghazi, during which two soldiers died.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Aircraft belonging to the Libyan National Army (LNA) attacked Derna on 17 January. Several sites belonging to the powerful local Abu Sleem brigade are said to have been hit, mainly weapons depots. Casualties are unknown although the LNA claims to have killed two members of the brigade and wounded another.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Authorities in the Libyan capital Tripoli arrested 1,000 people of different African nationalities for "entering the country illegally", and some of them died while resisting arrest. The Special Deterrence force of Libya's internationally-backed government arrested the suspects, including women, in Qirqarsh, west Tripoli. Sources in the force said some of the arrested people were killed in an armed clash with its members.
An armed group from Zawia again turned off the gas supply to the local power plant. Reports suggest the local Ahneish clan were involved.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Six LNA soldiers were killed in fighting on 18 January as Haftar's forces pressed with a major offensive to push militants out of all of Benghazi.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the United States
SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Al-Jazeera TV; Libya Herald
NOTES: The United States conducted coordinated air strikes that reportedly killed at least 90 members of the Islamic State group at a training camp located about 45 kilometers (30 miles) southwest of the coastal city of Sirte. Controversy surrounds whether the militants fled the eastern city Benghazi or Sirte.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Fighting raged in Shaabiyat al-Tira area of Qafunda district, on the western edges of Benghazi. Warplanes also bombed militant positions. It was not immediately clear if Thursday's fighting caused casualties.

Owing to electricity shortages, Ghat, Obari, Murzuk and Sebha have been particularly hard hit, with increasingly regular if small-scale protests taking place in numerous towns in the last ten days. The towns experiencing protest were not specified - coded to capital of Fezzan.

A car bomb exploded 20 January near a mosque in Benghazi, wounding between 12-17 people including a former interior minister. A security source said the blast was caused by an explosive device placed inside a car parked near Abu Houraira mosque in the central Al-Majouri neighbourhood of the eastern coastal city.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A car exploded on 21 January in the Dahra district of Tripoli near the Italian embassy killing two people who were inside the vehicle. It was not immediately clear if the blast was accidental or an attack on a militia base or whether the Italian embassy, which had reopened less than two weeks ago, was the target. Al-Arabiya reported that it was a suicide attack

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: A senior commander in the 210 Brigade is reported to have been killed on 22 January in a landmine explosion as troops continued their slow push into the main Benghazi militant enclave of Ganfouda.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: A Libya National Army airforce MiG warplane conducted an airstrike targeting the western entrance of Derna. No reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: At least three soldiers and six militants were killed on 23 January in Benghazis Ganfouda district as the LNA claimed to have shrunk the area held by militants from some 40 properties to just a dozen.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Six LNA soldiers were killed in clashes in the Ganfouda district of Benghazi.
Residents of Sebha held protests on 24 January demanding Obari power station finally be completed to help ease the electricity problems that have disrupted the south in recent weeks.

A car exploded on 25 January in the centre of Benghazi, leaving six wounded including five civilians and a soldier. It was not known whether the explosion was due to a suicide bombing or a car bomb, but the attack was likely aimed at a military convoy travelling along the road.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
SOURCE: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse; BBC Monitoring; Libya Herald
NOTES: The Libyan National Army (LNA) has reportedly taken full control of the western Benghazi district of Ganfouda.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: A commander of 298 Tank Brigade was killed in a land mine explosion in Ganfouda.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Retreating militants in Ganfouda district of Benghazi reportedly took a dozen hostages with them into their last position.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
NOTES: Misratan forces combing the area south-west of Sirte attacked last week by US stealth bombers say they have found 90 bodies in two separate locations. They also reported the capture of two militant suspects and the shooting dead of four more who refused to surrender.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: According to a Saiqa (Special forces) official, a convey of cars attempted to flee as the Libyan National Army (LNA) attacked what is known as 12 Buildings in Busnaib area of Ganfouda district in Benghazi. Saiqa apparently killed three of the militants in the ensuing firefight which led to the remaining combatants retreating back to the area. Some, though, may have escaped. During the fight, the LNA reportedly managed to seize eight buildings in the district.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Angry residents of west Tripolis Hay Andalus district blocked all main roads leading to the area, as well as burning tyres in protest at the presence of members of the Mobile Forces militia in their neighbourhood.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Two alleged copper smugglers from the al-Kani Brigade from Tarhouna were killed at a Garabulli checkpoint. According to reports, the two were stopped at the checkpoint and were found to be in possession of a load of copper which they were said to be taking to Misrata. Believing it to be stolen, the checkpoint guards attempted to arrest the two leading to a firefight in which the militants died. Tarhouna Municipal Council said that one of its people had died.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Garabulli municipality reported that eight local residents were killed on 28 January when gunmen from Tarhouna attacked the town, 60 kilometres east of Tripoli. The incident followed the killing at a Garabulli checkpoint some hours earlier of two alleged copper smugglers from Tarhouna. The alleged copper smugglers and the Tarhouna fighters are said to have been members of the Kani brigade, a powerful militia that controls much of Tarhouna and the surrounding areas.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: A Libya National Army airforce MiG warplane conducted an airstrike targeting the western entrance of Derna. No reports of casualties.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A government official was kidnapped when an unknown armed group stormed the finance ministry (GNA) in Tripolis Dahra district. The gunmen, believed to be part of a militia, attacked during working hours and dragged the head of the budget administration, Nuri Erhuma, out by force. He was released a few days later.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Misrata military council (MMC) has announced that all militias operating under its control will now join the Central Military Zone of the Libyan Army.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Clashes were reported in Gasr Ben Ghasir after Tarhuna traders, backed by Marghini militia, attempted to assert control over the central vegetable market in Gasr Ben Gashir. Known as Suq Al-Ahad (Sunday market), it reputedly provides Tripoli, 25 kilometres to the north, with some 50 percent of its vegetables. 5 people were reportedly killed.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
NOTES: One of the three House of Representatives (HoR) members for Kufra, Jibril Awhaidah, was kidnapped from his house in Tobruk. Formerly a member of the justice department in Kufra during Qaddafis time, Awhaidah comes from Kufras majority Zwai community.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The Audit Bureau in Tripoli reported that their colleague Sami Al-Laafi, was kidnapped on 31 January in Tripoli.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: 5 members of the Saiqa Special Forces were killed in clashes with militants in Ganfouda. An LNA airforce directed an airstrike at apartments that militants were positioned in.

Soldiers uncovered a mass grave in Ganfouda which contains an unknown number of bodies. Forensic experts are now examining the corpses, some of which appear to be quite recent.  It is unclear if the dead are militants, civilians or captured members of the LNA.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Three people who were injured in fighting in Gasr Ben Ghashir the day before are reported to have been murdered while being treated in a local hospital. Local gunmen are said to have stormed the Al-Afia medical centre and shot the three in what is being seen as an act of revenge.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Following a meeting with local elders and security forces, schools in Gasr Ben Gashir have been closed in protest at the armed militias operating in the town, and roads in and out were reported blocked.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Two residents were killed in west Tripoli's Tajoura district while they were queuing to withdraw money from a bank.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Clashes erupted between forces of the Libyan National Army (LNA) and an Islamist militia coalition in Libya's eastern city of Benghazi. The clashes broke out as the LNA's special brigade tried to advance into the last stronghold of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) in the neighbourhood of Qanfuda, west of the city. Six members of the LNA forces were killed and 18 others injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Two BRSC fighters were killed and seven others injured in an air strike by the LNA on their stronghold in Qanfuda.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Heavy clashes in the far west Tripoli district of Janzour near Bridge 17 broke out between Wirshefana militias and the Fursan Janzour brigade, with some sources suggesting up five people have been killed and 15 wounded. The fighting over control of the bridge, currently held by the Fursan Janzur (Janzour Knights), is said to have started after an individual, allegedly a Wirshefani, was caught trying to steal a vehicle close to the bridge.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Nine Libyan army solders were killed in the eastern city of Benghazi in clashes with militants after the army took control of the Ganfouda area in the city.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Random shelling in Janzour, 25 km northwest of Tripoli was reported on 3 February as fighting between neighbouring Wirshefana militias and Fursan Janzour Brigade (Janzour Knights) spiked when the Wirshefana approached the northern border of Janzour.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A corpse was discovered on 4 February in Tripoli. The body was that of the commander of Janzours Mobile Forces. Emhemmed Azzabi was found dead in the Hadba district in what appeared to be an assassination.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A Fursan Janzour spokesman said his brigade continued to be subject to random shelling on 4 February.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
NOTES: In Shahhat in the east a former General National Congress member Fawzi Al-Ogab was seized in circumstances that are still unclear.
A father and two of his children were injured by a landmine outside their house in Sirte. The property had reportedly once been used as an IS operations room.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The manager of the Al-Masara Clinic was kidnapped on 4 February. No further details of his abduction are known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: BRSC claimed to engage LNA units in 'Chinese Buildings' area of Ganfouda, Benghazi on 4 February.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Clashes broke out in the west Tripoli suburb of Janzour on 5 February. There have been reports of heavy artillery being used and two Fursan Janzour (Janzour Knights) Brigade members being killed. Five civilians were wounded, with one in a serious condition.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A television journalist was kidnapped in front of his Tripoli home on 5 February. The abductors told his wife that they wanted him for investigations.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Clashes erupted in Abu Sleem and Salahedeen districts in Tripoli between the Abu Sleem Central Security Force belonging to Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli (a.k.a. Ghneiwa) and gunmen loyal to Salah Al-Burki, most of them from Misrata. Reports indicate tanks and heavy mortar were used. There was shooting in Ain Zara and Tajoura. One of Ghneiwas main aides was killed.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Clashes erupted in Abu Sleem and Salahedeen districts in Tripoli between the Abu Sleem Central Security Force belonging to Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli (a.k.a. Ghneiwa) and gunmen loyal to Salah Al-Burki, most of them from Misrata. Reports indicate tanks and heavy mortar were used. There was shooting in Ain Zara and Tajoura. One of Ghneiwas main aides was killed.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Clashes erupted in Abu Sleem and Salahedeen districts in Tripoli between the Abu Sleem Central Security Force belonging to Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli (a.k.a. Ghneiwa) and gunmen loyal to Salah Al-Burki, most of them from Misrata. Reports indicate tanks and heavy mortar were used. There was shooting in Ain Zara and Tajoura. One of Ghneiwas main aides was killed.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Clashes erupted in Abu Sleem and Salahedeen districts in Tripoli between the Abu Sleem Central Security Force belonging to Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli (a.k.a. Ghneiwa) and gunmen loyal to Salah Al-Burki, most of them from Misrata. Reports indicate tanks and heavy mortar were used. There was shooting in Ain Zara and Tajoura. One of Ghneiwas main aides was killed.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Management and staff at the Tripoli headquarters of the Libyan Investment Authority (LIA) staged a mass walkout in protest at the instability and uncertainty caused by the ongoing change in their organizations chairmanship.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: At least two people are believed to be dead and another 13 wounded following Libyan National Army air strikes on the town of Hun near the Jufra air base. The main target appeared to be the Benghazi Defence Brigade militia, however there are other militias in the area including those from Misrata.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A number of armed factions in the west of Libya, but mainly from Misrata, today announced the formation of the Libyan National Guards (LNG), a group that is backing Khalifa Ghwell former prime minister of Libya Dawns National Salvation Government. LNG forces paraded through the main streets of Tripoli, including Martyrs Square. Similar LNG demonstrations seen in Zawia and Gharyan.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Two Libyan National Army (LNA) pilots were reported to have been killed when their helicopter crashed in an operation against the Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) south of Sirte. The BDB claimed it had attacked the helicopter, thought this hasn't been confirmed. The helicopter was involved in a series of airstrikes against a BDB convoy heading towards the Mabrouk oilfield operated by Frances Total oil. An LNA spokesman has been quoted saying that there were at least nine air strikes on the convoy and that five of the militants were killed and 20 wounded.
Local militiamen found the graves of three people east of Sirte. NGOs active in the region said they were discovered in buildings destroyed by conflict.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
NOTES: The major of Sirte disappeared along with his two bodyguards on 11 February, around 9 pm while on the road to Tripoli. It is believed that the three were seized somewhere near Khoms, some 120 kilomtres east of Tripoli.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: There were clashes in south Tripoli between the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade (TRB) headed by Haithem Tajouri and the mainly Misratan fighters under the command of Tripoli-based Misratan strongman Mahmud Baiyu, more usually known as Sharikan. Fighting was to do with an attempt by the latter to seize the main highway in the capital. The fighting was in the suburbs of Wadi Rabih, Ain Zara, Khala Al-Furjan and Salahedeen, in which heavy arms were used.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: There were clashes in south Tripoli between the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade (TRB) headed by Haithem Tajouri and the mainly Misratan fighters under the command of Tripoli-based Misratan strongman Mahmud Baiyu, more usually known as Sharikan. Fighting was to do with an attempt by the latter  to seize the main highway in the capital. The fighting was in the suburbs of Wadi Rabih, Ain Zara, Khala Al-Furjan and Salahedeen, in which heavy arms were used. The Sharikan militia succeeded in taking positions in the Khala Al-Furjan neighbourhood.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: There were clashes in south Tripoli between the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade (TRB) headed by Haithem Tajouri and the mainly Misratan fighters under the command of Tripoli-based Misratan strongman Mahmud Baiyu, more usually known as Sharikan. Fighting was to do with an attempt by the latter to seize the main highway in the capital. The fighting was in the suburbs of Wadi Rabih, Ain Zara, Khala Al-Furjan and Salahedeen, in which heavy arms were used.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: There were clashes in south Tripoli between the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade (TRB) headed by Haithem Tajouri and the mainly Misratan fighters under the command of Tripoli-based Misratan strongman Mahmud Baiyu, more usually known as Sharikan. Fighting was to do with an attempt by the latter to seize the main highway in the capital. The fighting was in the suburbs of Wadi Rabih, Ain Zara, Khala Al-Furjan and Salahedeen, in which heavy arms were used.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: The LNA claimed to have destroyed 40 BDB vehicles as they approached the Mabruk oilfield.
Protest in Beida in support of a Libyan National Army commander, whose Beida home was raided by armed men after he announced he had quit Hafters forces.

Colonel Faraj Al-Barasi claimed that his farm near Beida was fired on and occupied by armed men who were looking for him. He said he had not been at home but the attackers spent some time in the house and had taken goods and cars. He blamed armed forces commander-in-chief Khalifa Hafter and told Alwasat that he was leaving the LNA and the Dignity Operation.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Egypt's armed forces in cooperation with the Libya National Army secured the release of 13 Egyptians who were kidnapped in the northeastern Libyan city of Ajdabiya.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Reports of an attempted raid on the home in Beida of the Libyan National Armys former Derna Operation Room commander Faraj Al-Barasi on 14 February. Some reports allege the gunmen were linked to Salafist groups, although it is more generally believed that they were connected to the LNA. There are Salafist Madkhali units working within the LNA. The attackers are said to have come under heavy fire from Barasis entourage. One was reported killed and later reports suggested that some family members of Colonel Faraj Al-Barasi were abducted.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Bombs were dropped on Hun by aircraft linked to the Libyan National Army (LNA). Casualties are unconfirmed although some reports suggest there could have been two fatalities. The LNA are understood to have targeted the Benghazi Defence Brigade (BDB) which has been using the base as its operational headquarters. The air force says it carried out three airstrikes, destroying a number of vehicles and killing a number of BDB supporters.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: There are unconfirmed reports that the nephew of armed forces commander-in-chief Khalifa Hafter has been kidnapped in Benghazi. It is claimed that he was taken by members of the Barasa tribe in revenge for the abduction of members of the family of Colonel Faraj Al-Barasi, the former head of the Omar Mukhtar Operations Room, apparently seized when gunmen tried but failed to seize the colonel  in two separate attempts last week. He has since quite the LNA

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
NOTES: One soldier a member of the Saiqa Special Forces, was killed on 18 February in Ganfouda district in Benghazi, but it is not clear how. It is also being said that two militant suspects were caught trying to slip through the LNA cordon.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A motorcade transporting Presidency Council (PC) head/Government of National Accord prime minister Faiez Serraj, head of the State Council Abdulrahman Sewehli and the head of the Presidential Guard Najmi Nakoa, came under heavy shooting in Tripoli. Sewehli accussed Khalifa Ghwell's Libya National Guard of trying to assassinate him as the firing came from the armed groups based in the (Rixos) Palaces area of Tripoli. It was reported that two guards in the motorcade were slightly injured. An adviser to the PC, privately say that the whole affair was a fake and is being used to generate sympathy for the Presidency and State councils.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: LNA artillery and rockets hit the downtown militant enclaves of Suq Al-Hout and Sabri.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: LNA artillery and rockets hit the downtown militant enclaves of Suq Al-Hout and Sabri.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Fighting continued in Ganfouda with two more severely damaged apartment blocks reportedly being overrun by the LNA. This means the militants are now holding just six. The fighting cost the army three more dead and an unknown number of wounded.

The coast road between Tripoli and Misrata was blocked following the outbreak of clashes east of Zliten (160 kilometres east of Tripoli). The fighting was between the Misratan Al-Mahjoub brigade and the Zliten Joint Security Room, a relatively new group tasked with keeping security in the municipality. Two people killed and three injured. The clashes happened in Suq Al-Thulatha, six kilometres east of Zliten and on the border with Misrata municipality.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: A senior BRSC militant was killed in an airforce strike on the remaining positions in the 12 Buildings complex in Ganfouda, Benghazi. Libyan National Army jets and helicopter gunships continue to pound the apartment blocks where BRSC fighters are holed up alongside militants from IS and Ansar Al-Sharia.

A man accused of being a fighter with the so-called Islamic State (IS) is reported to have been summarily executed by fighters linked to the Libyan National Army (LNA). A video was released by a group calling itself the Tariq Ibn Ziyad Brigade showing a man kneeling in a pile of dirt in Ajdabiya. The Tariq Ibn Ziyad Brigade is said to be a Madakhli Salafist unit operating with the LNA.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Benghazis security head, Saleh Hweidi, narrowly avoided being killed on 22 February when a car filled with explosives blew up as he drove between Sidi Faraj and Hawari. He sustained minor injuries, but no one else was hurt.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Fierce clashes broke out in Tripolis Abu Sleem district between the local militia led by Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli (also known as Ghneiwa), and his largely Misratan force belonging to Salah Al-Burki. Whilst the confirmed number of casualties is unconfirmed, some sources say at least eight dead bodies arrived in Abu Sleem.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Three soldiers and at least two militants died on 23 February in heavy fighting as the Libyan National Army still sought to overrun the last militant position in Benghazis Ganfouda district.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: The LNA announced that eight bodies have been found buried in a makeshift grave in one of the buildings in Ganfouda district of Benghazi. A further 36 corpses have been uncovered in a multiple burials in Ganfouda.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Al-Arabiya TV; Libya Herald
NOTES: Fighting between two rival armed groups in eastern Tripoli continued for a second day. At least eight people, including civilians, were killed in the Buslim and Hadaba districts, where the clashes took place. Rival armed groups battled for control of militia headquarters and the main road to the international airport. Haithem Tajouri, the leader of the Tripoli Revolutionary Bridges, sent in five tanks to support Ghneiwa. Ghneiwa captured a number of positions belonging to Burki in Abu Sleem and nearby areas.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Libyan National Army (LNA) troops renewed their assault on militants barricaded in Benghazi's besieged district of Ganfouda on 25 February.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Colonel Idris Al-Jali, the commander of the 102 Infantry Brigade was abducted on 25 February  by seven gunmen who blocked in his vehicle at Ras Al-Teen on the road from the airbase at Maturba, which is 27 kilometres south of Derna.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A 218 TV channel photographer was seized on 25 February and released a day later.  It is reported that his capture was a misunderstanding.  His freedom said to have been secured by Hashem Bishr after he was allegedly taken by men loyal to Abu Sleem commander Abdul Ghani Ghneiwa.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A popular Tripoli footballer was released on 26 February after being abducted in Tripoli on 25 February.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
SOURCE: Libya Herald; Xinhua General News Service
NOTES: A car bomb hit a Libyan National Army convoy killing two and injuring seven including a Saiqa Special Forces commander. The car bomb struck near a petrol station in Gwarsha. The explosives were hidden in a parked vehicle.

Sixty inmates at a police prison in Wadi Al-Shatti escaped when relatives of one of the prisoners attacked the jail to free him. It is understood that fighting with prison guards broke out as a result of the attack, which led to the captives being able to flee. No mention of armed attack.
Young protesters blocked the Brega fuel depot to demand work. The block led to Tobruk airport being closed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: The Libya National Army (LNA) used tanks and artillery to attack the three remaining apartment blocks in militant hands in Ganfouda district of Benghazi. An army source said that the bodies of three militants, one of them believed to be a Tunisian, have been by found by troops.
Al Jalaa hospital in Benghazi received an injured seven-year-old child, hit in the head by shrapnel from a shell left in Birkah district.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
SOURCE: Al-Wasat; Al-Nabaa TV; Al-Tanasuh; UNSMIL; Libya Herald
NOTES: On 28 February, LNA forces advanced in the 12th Project in Benghazi. Between 2-4 LNA Special Forces troops were killed (lower figure recorded). Four Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council fighters were reportedly killed in the area. UNSMIL reported that four civilians, including two foreigners were killed in shelling.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Members of the new Libyan National Guard and other supporters of Khalifa Ghwells resurrected National Salvation Government, such as Salah Al-Burkis Misratan militia,  mobilised, erected sand barriers, road blocks and stationed armoured vehicles in expectation of an attack by combined Tripoli forces, including Haithem Tajouris Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade and the militia run by Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli (a.k.a Ghneiwa) both of which nominally support the Presidency Council. The greatest concentration of barricades was in the Abu Sleem area and at Salah Badis militia base at Camp 77, between Bab Al-Azziziya, Qaddafis old HQ and the Nasr forest. The roads around the Rixos complex where Ghwell has set up his government are also blocked by shipping containers.

15 bodies were found in shallow graves in woodland near Sabratha. It appears that they too had been shot. The bodies may have been migrants, as 22 bodies were discovered on 4 March, killed by people-smugglers.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A football coach from the south was shot dead on 1 March in Tripolis eastern suburb of Tajoura. It is reported that two, possibly three, other colleagues who were with him are missing. He had just met the head of the House of Representatives, Ageela Saleh.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: IT staff from the Central Bank of Libya (CBL) went on strike. Two staff were arrested.
A small Turkish tanker has been seized by armed men in Zuwara and the eleven crew members taken prisoner.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: As the Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi (BDB) military convoys approached the oil ports the LNA conducted airstrikes with jets pounding one column of vehicles at Nufliya, 50 kilometres east of Sidra.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Reports that the Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi attacked Sidra port on 3 March. According to Al Jazeera (Doha) the BDB forced the LNA to retreat.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Following the attack on the oil terminals, a number of pro-BRSC sleepers in Benghazi took to the streets of Benghazi resulting in fresh clashes.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: The UN received reports of LNA fighters raiding the homes of presumed Islamist supporters in the Ras Lanuf region, arresting and detaining children and taking hostages. The reports suggest that those detained have been subjected to torture.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: The Libyan National Army lost control of part of the oil terminal town of Ras Lanuf to the Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) on 3 March. 9 LNA officers were killed, including the murder of an injured officer as the BDB overtook the hospital. A Brigades of the Defence of Benghazi (BDB) column, including units of the former Petroleum Facilities Guard of Ibrahim Jadhran, briefly captured the small airport south of Ras Lanuf. Pictures posted on social media showed Osama Jadhran, Ibrahim Jadhrans hardline Islamist brother, with BDB commander Mustafa Sharksi next to a captured Mi35 attack helicopter.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Hours after the Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi took control of Ras Lanuf airport, reinforcements from the LNAs 152 battalion arrived and staged a counter-attack, recapturing the airport.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: In response to the Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi (BDB advance) on Libya's oil ports, air raids were carried out in Ras Lanuf, Es Sidra, Ben Jawad and Harawa

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: In response to the Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi (BDB advance) on Libya's oil ports, air raids were carried out in Ras Lanuf, Es Sidra, Ben Jawad and Harawa

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Six LNA soldiers died on 4 March in the siege of the 12 Apartments complex in Ganfouda, Benghazi.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: In response to the Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi (BDB advance) on Libya's oil ports, air raids were carried out in Ras Lanuf, Es Sidra, Ben Jawad and Harawa

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: There were reports that the Libyan National Army retook Ras Lanuf from the Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) on 4 March. But later there were reports that soldiers had withdrawn towards Al-Uqaylah and even another 50 kilometres further east to the Brega export terminal. A total of 15 soldiers were killed over 48 hours of fighting. Five fatalities recorded on 4 March and nine fatalities on the 3 March.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: A series of air raids were conducted by the LNA against the Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi (BDB). The LNA claimed that the aircraft had targeted BDB vehicles but it appears that buildings were also hit in Ras Lanuf.
People-smugglers killed 22 African migrants on a beach in western Libya. The migrants were set to embark from Sabrata beach.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: On 4 March, the Ras Lanouf Medical Centre was hit in airstrikes, which resulted in the deaths of two male ambulance drivers and another man accompanying a patient.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Nofaliya, Bin Jawad, Sidra and Ras Lanuf under "control" of #SDB, #LNA-AF contiues to conduct airstrikes, clashes in Um Garanik

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Nofaliya, Bin Jawad, Sidra and Ras Lanuf under "control" of Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi (SDB), LNA-Airforce contiues to conduct airstrikes, clashes in Um Garanik.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Clashes in Um Garanik between Libya National Army (LNA) forces and Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: An LNA convoy reportedly came under fire as it moved through Ajdabiya, Jadhrans home town. Three people were arrested and said to be Jadhran supporters.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: A number of LNA fighters were killed and injured during an offensive they launched on Aqila, east of Ras Lanuf, according to Al-Jazeera. At least five BDB fighters were also injured in the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: The spokesman for the Libyan National Army (LNA) denied reports of ground clashes near Derna between it and the Shura Council of the Mujahideen in Derna (SCMD). However, there had been airstrikes on newly discovered mujahideen arms stores in Dahra Al-Hamra west of the town. An SCMD official however claimed that an LNA attempt to advance on Derna had been thwarted and a number of LNA fighters wounded.
Women activists in Tobruk protested on 5 March over members of House of Representatives (HoR) joining the delegation lead by Presidency Council leader Fayez al-Serraj to Moscow over the weekend.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Gunmen suspected of affiliation with the Libyan [Islamic] Fighting Group and supporters of the National Salvation Government took control of the country's security database system on 5 March. Up until the time that this report went to press, the Libyan Fighting Group has not claimed the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Fresh air strikes on 6 March hit the Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) around the oil terminal region of al-Sidra.
An unidentified group attacked an academic, smashed up equipment including electronic devices and threatened students studying at Bani Walid University.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Throughout the day, the LNA carried out a series of air strikes particularly around Ras Lanuf with a heavy raid going in the evening. There were also reported attacks on Ben Jawad  and Nufliya on the road west to Sirte and on Sidra.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: There were further civilian casualties from the Ganfouda neighbourhood of Benghazi, including a woman who died in airstrikes on 6 March.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: There has been shelling of Sabri, the downtown Benghazi  militant stronghold which was also strafed by at least one helicopter gunship.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Fighting in Ganfouda, Benghazi.

The commander of the Petroleum Facilities Guard (PFG), a key militia group that is allied with Libya's UN-sponsored Government of National Accord (GNA), has taken on responsibility for securing oil facilities and terminals in the country. On 6 March many Benghzi Defence Brigades fighters withdrew from Ras Lanuf and Sidra.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Renewed airstrikes reported in RasLanuf, Sidra and Nofaliya on 7 March, effectiveness unclear and no visible progress on the ground.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Renewed airstrikes reported in RasLanuf, Sidra and Nofaliya on 7 March, effectiveness unclear and no visible progress on the ground.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Renewed airstrikes reported in RasLanuf, Sidra and Nofaliya on 7 March, effectiveness unclear and no visible progress on the ground.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: A militia guarding the head office of the Aman Bank in west Tripolis Gurji district shot a customer dead on the morning of the 8 March. The militia guarding the bank are from Misrata while the dead man was originally from Zintan.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The head office of the Aman Bank in west Tripolis Gurji district was ablaze on 8 March after being attacked by angry locals after a member of the militia guarding the bank shot a customer dead in the morning.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: On 8 march in Benghazi, the LNA battled in the 12 Buildings area and seized a couple of damaged vehicles + tank from BRSC militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: A man, said to be a member of the Magharba tribe was videoed being repeatedly beaten by four LNA soldiers and forced to declared that Hafter was his lord" in the Ajdabiya region.

Former Petroleum Facilities Guard (PFG) leader Ibrahim Jadhran was seized by a gang in Nalut. According to the reports, Jadhran was detained by the same gang that he had employed to organise his return to Libya using the Dahiba-Wazen crossing on the Tunisian border. The border post on the Libyan side is controlled by militiamen from Nalut.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Reports of heavy airstrikes on 12 March on a range of Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) positions from the front line at Al Uqaylah to Ben Jawad in the west. The BDB claimed that they were delivered by the Egyptian air force. This was not verified.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Heavy artillery and rocket fire was heard from the Sabri district of Benghazi on 12 March in continued fighting between Libya National Army (LNA) forces and Benghazi Revolutionaries' Shura Council (BRSC) fighters.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Reports of heavy airstrikes on 12 March on a range of Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) positions from the front line at Al Uqaylah to Ben Jawad in the west. The BDB claimed that they were delivered by the Egyptian air force. This was not verified.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Clashes in the last two sections of the 12 Apartments complex in Ganfouda, Benghazi. One (Libya National Army) LNA soldier was killed, reportedly by a sniper, while three people from the complex were gunned down as they tried to escape

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ACTOR2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: The Libyan National Army (LNA) launched a major offensive on Benghazis Ganfouda district. Three LNA special forces fighters killed on 13 March and an unspecified number of Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) fighters killed. An LNA spokesman said that they had made important gains and consolidated its control on some areas.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Fighting between Tripoli Revolutionaries' Brigade and militias supporting Khalifa Ghwell spread to the Gargaresh district of Tripoli on 13 March.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Clashes spread to Ghot al Shall in Tripoli between Tripoli Revolutionaries' Brigade and militias supporting Khalifa Ghwell.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade; Abu Salim Brigade
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Fighting broke out in the Hay al-Andalus and Gargaresh districts of Tripoli between rival armed groups on 13 March. It was initially sparked by armed local residents and later supported by Tripoli Revolutionaries' Brigade and Ghneiwa militias (Abu Saleem) after the killing of a bank guard.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade; Abu Salim Brigade
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Fighting erupted in Gurji when armed locals attacked Misratan and Amazigh units supporting Khalifa Ghwell. Tripoli Revolutionaries' Brigade and Ghneiwa militias came out in support of residents.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Seven members of the oil installations guards were killed on 13 March, along with the destruction of a technical workshop in Ras Lanuf port as a result of air strikes from the Libyan airforce.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Two citizens were killed by an armed group in central Tripoli.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
SOURCE: Agence France Presse; BBC Monitoring; Al-Nahaa TV; Al-Jazeera TV; Libya Herald
NOTES: Troops commanded by Khalifa Haftar announced the recapture of the Ras Lanuf and al-Sidra oil installations. The LNA reported 10 fighters killed, the hospital reported 21 LNA fighters were killed and rival fighters of the Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) along with Petroleum Facilities Guards (PFG) were being chased back to their barracks. BDB media denied these reports.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: Reports that the Libyan National Army (LNA) pushed the Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) out of the Ben Jawad on 14 March.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Abu Salim Brigade; Special Deterrence Forces
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Fighting continued in the Hay al-Andalus and Gargaresh districts of Tripoli between rival armed groups on 14 March.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Fighting continued in the Hay al-Andalus and Gargaresh districts of Tripoli between rival armed groups on 14 March.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Abu Salim Brigade; Special Deterrence Forces
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Fighting continued in Gurji district of Tripoli between rival armed groups on 14 March. One one side were the RADA deterrence forces, Abu Saleem Central Security Brigade and the Tripoli Revolutionaries' Brigade.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
SOURCE: Agence France Presse; BBC Monitoring; Al-Nahaa TV; Al-Jazeera TV; Libya Herald
NOTES: Troops commanded by Khalifa Haftar announced the recapture of the Ras Lanuf and al-Sidra oil installations. The LNA reported 10 fighters killed, the hospital reported 21 LNA fighters were killed and rival fighters of the Benghazi Defence Brigades (BDB) along with Petroleum Facilities Guards (PFG) were being chased back to their barracks. BDB media denied these reports.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Al-Nabaa TV was caught up in clashes in Tripoli on 14 March was set on fire, possibly after being hit by RPG fire.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: On 14 March, the al-Khadhra Hospital in Tripoli was hit twice by indiscriminate fire, causing damage to the maternity ward and Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ACTOR2: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: The LNA said that its aircraft had been striking that BDB and its allies in Jufra and that  troops were moving south towards them. Exact date not specified.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Abu Salim Brigade; Special Deterrence Forces
ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Al-Arabiya; Libya Herald; Al-Wasat
NOTES: Forces loyal to Libya's UN-backed unity government seized the headquarters of militia loyal to former prime minister Khalifa Ghweil on 15 March. Al-Arabiya TV reported a "huge explosion" that hit the Rixos hotel at Bab Ben Ghashir in Tripoli, killing at least one individual and leaving several people wounded. Libya's former prime minister Khalifa Ghweil was wounded in the fighting. Haitham Tajouris Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade joined forces with Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli's, also known as Ghneiwa's, Abu Saleem Centural Security Force and the RADA Special Deterrence Force to retake control, according to the Tripoli operations room.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Libyan National Army bomb disposal experts defused a car bomb in Brega.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: The siege of the 12 Apartments complex in Ganfouda, Benghazi continued against the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC). The BRSC posted that one of its commanders was killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Reports of clashes to the east of Sirte between LNA units and the Misratan 166 Brigade which is in charge of security in the town.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Three gold merchants were abducted in Tripoli "because of their identity, because they are from Misrata".

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: In the wake of the ceasefire agreement, gunmen took control of Sirte's Gumhouria Bank in downtown Tripoli.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Small-scale fighting breaking out in Hadba al-Khadra district of Tripoli on 16 March after the Tripoli Revolutionaries' Brigade rejected a ceasefire agreement.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The National Anti-Corruption Commission in Hay al-Andalus in Tripoli, the ministries of justice, labour and interior as well as hundreds of homes and shops were looted during clashes on 15 March. Key corruption investigation files were stolen.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Overnight on 17 March, an unknown number of militants was killed when the boat on which they were said to be escaping Sabri was intercepted by a naval vessel.  Marine Lieutenant Akram Zalgam said that the militants craft had been spotted with night vision equipment and sunk by gunfire.

On 17 March, Misrata municipal council officers were briefly attacked by gunmen. The hardliners are from a number of smaller militias from the city, all of which oppose both the Presidency Council and Khalifa Hafter. These militias, which support fellow Misratan Khalifa Ghwell as prime minister, include Salah Badis brigade and the so-called Presidential Guard which was formerly protecting the Rixos complex in Tripoli.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Three reporters from 218 TV Channel were abducted on 17 March but were released a day later.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Pro-Haftar protests in Tripoli's Algeria and Martyr's square against Misratan influence in the capital, Tripoli. The protesters were fired upon to disperse. No reports of casualties.

There have been public protests against the anti-Misrata protests that took place in Tripoli. A substantial group of Misratan revolutionaries and their supporters gathered at the Dafniya checkpoint west of the city, on the road to Tripoli, and forced its closure.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: In an undated video, a man in military fatigues is seen being chased out of a building by a mob of more than a dozen fighters, most dressed in army fatigues. They beat, insult, and throw him to the ground, then line up in a row facing him and several summarily execute him with machine guns. Benghazi activists say that this incident took place in the Qwarsha district of Benghazi. Human Rights Watch was unable to confirm the exact circumstances of this incident.
A car-bombing at Nufliya is reported to have gone wrong when the driver overturned the vehicle. It is not reported what happened to the driver but LNA technicians made the device safe.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: A Libyan National Army (LNA) Mig-21 plane crashed on 18 March. It is understood to have been launching a strike at Sabri, which with Suq Al-Hout is now the last militant-held position in the city. The official explanation for the Migs loss is that this was yet another mechanical failure but some witnesses are insisting the aircraft was shot down.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
NOTES: In an undated video, a captain in the LNA special forces, is seen shooting three handcuffed-men in the back of the head with a machine gun as they kneel facing a wall with their hands tied behind their backs. Local journalists told Human Rights Watch that the executions took place in Benghazi during the final battle for Ganfouda on or around March 18, 2017. The three victims were Tuareg fighters from Ubari who appeared on photos, while alive, apparently in detention by LNA forces.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Five special forces members were killed in fighting in Ganfouda district on 18 March. The Libyan National Army announced that the district had finally been liberated. It is now being said that 43 militants perished in the final assault, not 28 as originally reported, including two who blew themselves up as troops came near them.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: LNA spokesman Ahmed Mismari said yesterday they had found a mass grave of Islamist militants, including Ansar Al-Sharia commanders and the corpse of Makhzoum. Mismari said the Red Crescent was going to be recovering the other bodies. This seems to have been the spot where the militants took their dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Libyan National Army (LNA) forces have been accused of committing war crimes including killing and beating civilians, and summarily executing and desecrating bodies of opposition fighters in Benghazi. The army forces allegedly intercepted civilians trying to flee a besieged neighborhood, some accompanied by opposition fighters, and the whereabouts of some civilians are unknown. According to witnesses, LNA fighters intercepted about seven families after one of their cars broke down and attacked and killed some of them and arrested others. HRW documents four known deaths, UNSMIL documents 7 deaths (4 women, 2 children and 1 elderly man).
Misrata TV was attacked on 19 March by militants who threatened staff. The local radio station was also targeted.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Reports that the Al-Buni militia from Suq Al-Juma stormed the Busetta naval base in Tripoli where the Presidency Council is headquarted.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: On 20 March the Misratan Third Force were forced to cede the Gwirat Al-Mal checkpoint near Tamanhint to the LNA forces under General Nayel. The road from Jufra to Sebha was blocked as the Libyan National Army (LNA) mounted a fresh assault on the Tamenhint airbase held by the Misratan Third Force.
An Obari bank manager was kidnapped on 20 March by unidentified gunmen.
Members of the Obari municipal council and civil society organisations demonstrated demanding that a kidnapped bank manager be freed immediately.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: the Libyan National Army (LNA) found the bodies of seven of its own soldiers in the complex. It is unclear if they had been captured and executed or killed in the fighting.

On 22 March, a 12-year-old Sudanese boy was injured in the shoulder in the Ard Zwawa neighbourhood of Benghazi. The circumstances of the shooting are unclear, but there were no clashes in the area at the time.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Air raid by LNA-AF Mi-35 reported this on 23 March hitting MSCD targets in Dhahr al-Ahmar south of Derna.
Rival protests in Misrata on 24 March, both for and against the municipal council.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Shura Council of Derna Mujahideen (MSCD) clashed with  a gathering of LNA forces, targeting them with a 9M113 Konkurs/AT-5 Spandrel ATGM in the area of Wadi Sutabah, SW of Derna.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Two LNA-AF airstrikes reported in Fattaih, south of Derna, photos purportedly show plume of smoke from the 2nd strike.

The head of the council of elders in the oil terminal district of Sidra was reported to have been seized on 25 March while travelling from Ajdabiya to his home in Ras Lanuf. It is suggested that Abdulsalem Bulahi Al-Maghrabi was taken by members of the Libyan National Army (LNA).  120 abductions have been reported recently in the oil crescent towns of Ajdabiya, Brega, Ras Lanuf, and Sidra  most of them members of the Magharba tribe, and most of them blamed on the LNA.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: LNA-AF airstrike earlier today targeted Shura Council of Derna Mujahideen (MSCD) in the hills south of the city of Derna.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Airstrikes reported in Souq al-Hout targeting BRSC militants.

Electricity production at the Ruwais power station near Nalut in the Jebel Nafusa has been dramatically reduced after protestors turned off the gas supply. Valves on the pipeline from Enis Wafa field were turned off near the station by members of the Petroleum Facilities Guard claiming that they were owed money.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: A supply boat was intercepted and sunk a mile offshore of Sabri district in Benghazi. The boat is said to have exploded when hit by gunfire.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Air raids on Sabri and the nearby militant district of Suq Al-Hout in Benghazi.
A local resident was reported to have been shot at near the Tamanhint airbase gate by a member of the Third Force.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
ALLY_ACTOR_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: BRSC claims targeting an #LNA gathering at the Shajara Square with S-5 rocket resulting in direct hit
Pipeline blockade at Ryayina, possibly by militia.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: On 28 March, a security guard at the National Commercial Bank was shot dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
NOTES: The commander of the Libyan National Armys Saiqa Special Forces reportedly escaped a car bombing in Benghazi on 29 March when an explosives-laden vehicle was spotted and defused. The location was not given though it is thought to have been near Benina.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: The LNA have been carrying out air regular strikes on positions held by mujahideen forces in Derna for some time. These have largely concentrated in recent days on the outlying Dahra Al-Hamra district.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The Dar Al-Ifta in Tripoli has claimed its building was attacked on 30 March by gunmen. A Dar Al-Ifta source said that the attackers had been travelling in an armoured vehicle and had sprayed the building with bullets.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: A mine sapper died in Benghazi's Gwarsha district when a device he was attempting to defuse blew up.
The sharp rise in meat prices brought out an angry crowd in Tobruk demanding a boycott of butchers until the cost is cut.
2 civilians were killed by a landmine planted by suspected militants while working in their fields in the Gwarsha area of Benghazi.
An angry crowd gathered in Tobruk and announced a boycott of butchers until meat prices which have recently risen sharply fall.

ACTOR1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
NOTES: Militants in Benghazi blew up a bridge at Al-Thama on the coastal road heading into Sabri.
A sailor and a civilian were killed by a sniper in Benghazi on 2 April when a family car tried to cross the Guiliana Bridge.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: On 4 April, LNA aircraft attacked Jufra airbase, some 350 kilometres northeast of Tamenhint. It is held by Misratan forces as well as being a operating base for the Bengahzi Defence Brigades. The LNA airstrikes targeted weapons storage.

A large force comprising mainly the Benghazi-based Zawiya Martyrs Brigade led by Brigadier Jamal Al-Zahawi is reported to have set out on 5 April from Benghazi to attack the Jufra base. No direct clashes yet reported.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Two aircraft thought to belong to Misratan forces are reported to have bombed Brak Al-Shatti airbase on the afternoon of the 5 April in reprisal for the airstrikes on Tamenhint airbase the same morning. It is not known if there were any casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Following the first set of airstrikes by Libyan National Army (LNA) forces on Tamanhint airbase, there was gunfire on the other side of the base as LNA forces under General Mohamed Ben Nayel undertook a coordinated push to oust Misratas Third Force troops.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Forces loyal to Libya's eastern authorities carried out air strikes on the southern Tamenhant air base where the Misrata Third Force are located. No casualties and Misrata's Third Force remained in control.

Two men in Sirte are reported to have been killed by a landmine planted next to a major water storage tank. They are understood to have worked for the water company in the town. The landmine is assumed to have been planted by the so-called Islamic State before it was forced out of the town.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Forces loyal to Libya's eastern authorities battled with the aim of seizing the southern Tamenhant air base from the Misrata Third Force. No reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Small arms fire reported near Tamanhint airbase on 9 April. No reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
NOTES: The Benghazi Defence Brigade announced that it has pulled out of Jufra airbase near Hun and handed it over the general chief of staff of the Libyan army (the army supporting the Presidency Council). It says it has gone to another location, but has not disclosed where.
Oil production at the Al-Sharara field in southwest Libya has been suspended after protesters shut off a pipeline, a refinery source said on 10 April.
An unidentified armed group, referred to as the Nalut group, shut down the Wafa gas pipeline on 9 April.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Misratas Third Force said it recaptured the village of Samnu, east of Tamenhint, on 10 April. At the time, the Presidency Councils defence ministry the spokesman, Mohamed Al-Ghasri, said that the 12th Brigade, part of the Libyan National Army, had been forced to flee to the mountains.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: LNA acknowledged three dead originating from Samnu, with 3rd Force/201 Brigade/SDB claiming to have seized 7 technicals & a tank amidst fighting with forces led by Mohamed Ben Nayel (12th Brig.) in the area of Samnu.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Additional airstrike targeting 3rd Force/SDB on the road between Zagn and Samnu, and another targeting the Fuqaha Gate.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Reports by both LNA & SDB sources that LNA-AF has hit a Bonyan al-Marsous camp in Sawknah, no casualties reported

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: LNA-AF aircraft taking off from Brak al-Shati airbase targeted the Misrata's 3rd force at Tamanhint airbase, 3 dead and 7 wounded reported.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: An armed attack took place on the house of the governor of the Central Bank of Libya in Tripoli during protests against the devaluation of the Libyan currency.
A 24 year-old Algerian nurse working in Misrata was kidnapped on 11 April. Her family fear that she has been abducted by Islamic State militants though no verification of this has been given.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The acting head of the Tripoli Civil Registry Authority, was kidnapped by militias in Tripoli on 11 April. He was later released. Another colleague was also reported to have been taken away by an armed group. The CRA named the Bab Tajura brigade as their kidnappers. They accused them of haggling with him for a price in exchange for handing over access to the countrys civil registry database.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Clashes reported south of Jaghub near border w/Egypt between LNA's Omar Mukhtar Brigade & unknown armed group. 5 members from the Omar Mukhtar Brigade reportedly killed, 8 others abducted and 2 technicals seized following attack. Reports indicate Chadian opposition behind the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: There were reports that a unit belong to the Mohamed Ben Nayels 12th Brigade, part of the Libyan National Army, had surrounded the village of Samnu, east of Tamenhint, which Misratas Third Force said it recaptured on 10th April.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: In a reprisal attack for targeting the Tamanhint airbase, Misratan forces were reported to have attacked the LNA-controlled airbase in Brak Al-Shatti with Soviet-era aircraft, killing five.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: The Libyan National Army (LNA) resumed its aerial assault of the Third Force-held Tamenhint airbase, north-east of Sebha.
Allegations that the Misratan Third Force killed four young Salafist supporters of the LNA at a checkpoint near the village of Samnu. Date unclear.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Reports of renewed airstrikes targeting Misrata's ThirdForce/SDB in the area of Samnu.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Airstrikes were reported on 13 April, three kilometres north of Sebha that reportedly targeted the premises of a Turkish company which the LNA apparently believed had been aiding the Misratan Third Force.

Protestors bricked up the Misrata municipality entrance in a move to try and demonstrate that Misratas municipal council is no longer working. The opponents involved are reported to be allied to the rejectionist movement of would-be prime minister Khalifa Ghwell.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: The former Peoples Hall between Tripolis Suq Al-Thalath roundabout and Hay Al-Andalus was again set on fire. The reasons are as yet unknown. Some locals have accused Haithem Tajouris Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade of setting alight the building which once housed Qaddafis General Peoples Congress. Others have accused the Mobile Forces which supports Khalifa Ghwell and is firmly opposed to Tajouri.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: The Libyan National Army (LNA) resumed airstrikes in the south attacking positions held by Misratas Third Force near Sebha Airport, south-east of the town. There were no casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Libyan National Army Airforce airstrike this morning in Fattaih, south of Derna.
Protestors bricked up the Misrata municipality entrance for the second time on 15 April in a move to try and demonstrate that Misratas municipal council is no longer working.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Ten gunmen attacked a passport officer. The passport officer was severely beaten by members of a militia which is paid by the Government of National Accord (GNA) interior ministry to guard the airport. The militia was not named.

ADMIN1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
NOTES: Tripolis Mitiga airport came to a standstill when passport officers went on strike after one of their colleagues was reportedly beaten up by gunmen the night before.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: The Tamanhint airbase was subject to violent air raids carried out by [Operation] Dignity [i.e. LNA] militias on the airbase on 16 April that caused material damage to buildings inside the base.

Fighting in Tarhouna on 17 Apri left 15 people dead, almost all from the Basbusa family. Reports claim that those responsible were the local Kani brigade, a outwardly Islamist, family-controlled militia which now dominates the formerly pro-Qaddafi town. Members of the Basbusa family attacked the towns joint operations rooms after one of its members had been arrested. The brigade then allegedly attacked others of the Basbusa family.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Heavy clashes in the Tamanhint airbase in southern Libya between Libyan National Army (LNA) forces and the Third Force, a powerful militia from the Libyan city of Misrata. The airbase was subjected to heavy artillery bombardment in the early hours of 18 April and the shelling destroyed the base's runway and caused damage to other buildings.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
