Police forces intervened to disperse peaceful protesters in Teborsouk using teargas. The demonstrators demanded the dismissal of the local delegate and his staff, and protested the poor development of the region.
Roadblocks were erected in Dehiba obstructing the passage of vehicles across the border with Libya. The sit-in enterred the sixt day on 29th April.
Protesters in El Kamour continued their sit-in and demonstrated in El Kamour
Roadblocks were erected in Dehiba obstructing the passage of vehicles across the border with Libya. The sit-in enterred the sixt day on 29th April.
In El Hamma, a group of young people occupied the the offices of the delegation and destroyed official documents. They also blocked the route 16 connecting El Hamma to Kebili.

The employees of the governorate of Kairouan protested and blocked the circulation of vehicles outside th governorate. They protested against violent protests and demanded that security forces are deployed to protest them.
As protests in El Kamour continued, a group of women staged a protest sit-in on Wednesday in Tataouine.
A week of rage started on Wednesday in Oueslatia with a protest outside the local administration's offices.
Protesters blocked the entrance to the industrial zone of Ghannouch to denounce rampant unemployment and marginalisation.
Villagers from Kraouet Ouergha protested outside the governorate of Sidi Bouzid against a proposed plan that would join their village to the municipality of Rahal.
As protests in El Kamour continued, a group of women staged a protest sit-in on Wednesday in Tataouine.
Roadblocks were erected in Dehiba obstructing the passage of vehicles across the border with Libya. The sit-in enterred the sixt day on 29th April.
Residents burnt tyres in a road north of Kairouan.
Police intervened to disperse protesters in Ghannouch on Thursday.

Two protests took place on Thursday in Tunis. During a sit-in outside the Instance for Truth and Dignity, a group of people who were granted amnesty after the revolution demanded that their properties are reassigned to them. In a separate protest movement, a group of martyrs of the revolution demanded the official list of the martyrs and an acceleration in the legal procedure.
Roadblocks were erected in Dehiba obstructing the passage of vehicles across the border with Libya. The sit-in enterred the sixt day on 29th April.
Rioters burn tyres to demand unemployment in the remote region of Matmata.
Protesters devastated the offices of the delegation of Mellouleche in Mahdia.
Roadblocks were erected in Dehiba obstructing the passage of vehicles across the border with Libya. The sit-in enterred the sixt day on 29th April.
Protesters started a sit-in in Douz region.
In Ksar Ouled Debbab, a group of protesters gathered and set their electricity bills on fire demanding development.

A protest was staged on Saturday at Habib Bourguiba Avenue in the capital against the bill on economic and financial reconciliation. Protesters, who rallied outside the Tunis Municipal Theatre, reaffirmed their categorical opposition to the draft law on reconciliation, saying it violates, in many respects, the Constitution, the Transitional Justice Act and the process of establishing the truth.

Workers at Kakira Sugar Factory went on a sit down strike on 13 May. The workers had put down their tools protesting against low wages and arrest of their colleagues who were also participating in the protest. They attempted to set the sugar cane plantations ablaze but police responded on time to arrest 23 of them.
Workers are demonstrating and striking to protest sexual harassment at a Chinese-owned construction company.
101 M23 rebels, who had escaped from the Bihanga Military Training School in Uganda, were intercepted on their way to the DRC. They are currently detained at Makenke Barracks.
A man was stabbed to death on his way home from Arua town. His village believes that the perpetrators were Kakwa and Yivo who targeted him because he is Galanji.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Kakwa Ethnic Group (Uganda); Yivo Ethnic Group (Uganda)
NOTES: Galanji villagers attacked Kakwa and Yivo people, beating them, burning their huts, and looting livestock. Close to 60 homesteads have been abandoned, as the people fled to the DRC.
A crowd of people attacked and tried to lynch a man accused of rape. The police fired shots to disperse the mob.

Police discovered that local residents were plotting to attack Nakivale Refugee Camp over land tensions, so they arrested the ringleaders. The residents broke into a violent demonstration, blocking the road to the refugee camp. The police responded with teargas and bullets. A number of people were arrested.
750 M23 militants are reported to have escaped this week from Bihanga Military Training Camp.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
NOTES: Residents in Busanza heard gunfire between the M23 and DRC military and fled their homes.
The Ugandan military arrested 42 M23 militants.
Fighting erupted in Kisoro when Ugandan soldiers tried to arrest M23 rebels crossing from the DRC into the Mgahinga National Park. A UPDF soldier and an M23 militant were shot dead.
Students held violent protests at Kyambogo University. They destroyed property and police responded with tear gas and rubber bullets.
A trader was shot by cops who were dispersing  a crowd that wanted to lynch people they suspected to be involved in child sacrifice.
Police spokesman Andrew Felix Kaweesi, his driver and the bodyguard Corporal Kenneth Erau have been shot dead during a shooting near his home in Kampala.
Clashes between cattle keepers or Basongora and farmers, who are mainly Bakonzo, broke out in Kasese. Over 10 farmers sustained grave injuries.

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) presidential candidate  Rtd. Dr. Colonel Kizza Besigye came under attack in Teso Sub-region as police fired teargas and rubber bullets at his supporters to disperse them.
Interns at Mulago Hospital began a strike to protest the fact that they have not been paid for 3 months.
Traders at Arua Park held a peaceful demonstration to protest an increase in rent. A private security guard shot at the protesters, killing 1.

A mob of residents attacked 3 people believed to have mugged a member of the community. The police fought the mob to rescue the alleged muggers and arrested them. The crowd then attacked the police station and had to be dispersed with teargas.
Supporters of the NRM candidate, Kidega attacked supporters of the independent candidate in the Aruu North Parliamentary By-Election. 3 people were injured and 25 people have been arrested.
Police fired live ammunition and teargas to disperse a crowd of people who had gathered to receive food aid from FDC officials. 2 people were injured.
Students staged a violent protest to disrupt the Student Guild Elections. Police fired teargas and fought running battles with the rioters.
A Ugandan journalist who had spoken out about the arrest of Ugandan activist Stella Nyanzi, was abducted, driven around, and dumped on the road.
A man who was caught bribing voters was beaten up by a crowd of people in Kamuli town.
Staff at the National Forestry Authority started a strike to protest that they have not yet been paid. They tried to hold the manager hostage.

The Buganda Kingdom Finance Officer hired a militia to evict 50 people from Bugabo Village. The militia drove a tractor through people's fields and used machetes to clear the crops and destroy housing. The angry residents set the tractor alight. Police have subsequently arrested 16 of the militia.
The FDC candidate for the president of the Makerere Business School Student Guild was attacked and stabbed as he returned from campaigning.
More than 30 armed men attacked the Ngenge Police Station. Police and soldiers exchanged fire with the group for an hour. 1 police officer and 4 attackers were killed in the incident.
Hundreds of Ugandans protested against Chinese traders and businesses.

Police attempted to block a DP meeting at Tropic Inn Hotel in Masaka. DP supporters clashed with police forces outside the hotel. The police then arrested the local MP Mpuuga and some journalists. The police used teargas and live ammunition to clear the crowd that gathered outside the police station.
700 miners at Konkola Copper Mine are refusing to work over a salary dispute.
Following orders from the party Secretary General, PF cadres have taken over the bus station and are using buses to extort money for the party.
Zambian Railway workers are on strike to demand better conditions for service. The Zambia Railways Limited has locked the workers out of the premises.
Students at privately-owned Apex University demonstrated against the high fees at the university.
A group of marketers marched to show their support for Lungu and the mayor of Kitwe, who is being criticised for evicting vendors.
Copperbelt University lecturers and staff are striking to protest that their salaries have not yet been paid this year.
At least 55 people were detained in Zambia's Luanshya town on the Copperbelt Province after riots sparked by reports of a local business couple involved in black magic to enhance his business.

ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
NOTES: UPND cadres harassed and beat up 2 journalists at a UPND event in Lusaka. They accused the journalists of being ZNBC reporters. Police then denied UPND the right to hold the event.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: UPND: United Party for National Development
NOTES: Police ambushed the Zambian opposition leader Hichilema in his house. They fired teargas on him and his family and assaulted his servants.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: UPND: United Party for National Development
NOTES: UPND cadres armed with pangas caused chaos in the Kamwala Market in Lusaka, before the police intervened and arrested 7 of them.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: ZANU-PF supporters assaulted an MDC-T supporter for wearing party regalia
The Police Support Unit assaulted 3 men who were accused of illegally mining diamonds.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: A vendor selling wares close to Harvest House was assaulted by ZANU PF supporters who were riding around town in a truck chanting slogans.
Shona miners attacked Ndebele miners with machetes. 6 people were hospitalised. The military has been deployed to calm the situation.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: NCA candidate, Madock Chivasa, and his election agent were ambushed and attacked by 10 unidentified ZANU youths while campaigning for the Bikita West by-election.
Vendors fought running battles with the police, who came to enforce a ban on the sale of all foodstuffs.
The Police Support Unit tortured 4 men and 2 women who were accused of mining diamonds illegally.
A member of Zim PF was attacked by unidentified assailants in Chitungwiza.
The Police Support Unit assaulted a man accused of illegally mining diamonds.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: An MDC-T supporter was assaulted by ZANU youths at the 4th Street Bus Terminus for wearing a shirt promoting human rights.

Riots broke out in central Harare as vendors fought running battles with the police, who were trying to confiscate their wares and arrest them for vending. A vendor sustained injuries when he was attacked.

ACTOR2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: Violent clashes broke out between bus operators and ZANU youths, who were trying to claim space in the bus terminus under the guise of the anti-typhoid clean-up.

Municipal Officers assaulted a female vendor during a typhoid clean-up campaign. A passer-by asked why they were assaulting her. He was taken to the Municipal Police Headquarters and assaulted. Another female vendor was also taken to the Headquarters and assaulted.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: A youth was attacked by ZANU PF supporters, who accused him of influencing people to vote against Mugabe in 2018.
2 vendors selling wares outside Harvest House were attacked by Riot Police. 1 was arrested and taken to Harare Central Police Station, where he was beaten using metal road spikes.
A vendor outside Harvest House was attacked by police officers, who broke his leg.

Vendors clashed with police in the centre of Harare. 2 vendors and an onlooker were apprehended by plainclothes policemen, who assaulted them in the street, and then arrested them and charged them with public violence. They were assaulted again when they got to the police station.
Supporters of Pastor Evan Mawarire gathered at the courts to support him. He had been arrested as he tried to enter the country.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: An MDC-T official who had been campaigning was waylaid and assaulted by ZANU PF youths at Goromonzi Business Centre.
A ZimPF official was attacked by unidentified assailants at her home in Chitungwiza. They demanded to see the ZimPF receipt books.
6 Municipal Police Officers were injured when they were stoned by vendors who were angry at having been evicted in the Typhoid clean-up.
2 men, who were arrested when vendors attacked the police, were tortured in police custody.
A female vendor was seized by the police, beaten, and thrown into a police vehicle, leaving her 2 year old child on the street. She has not been located.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU PF youths attacked members of Transform Zimbabwe who were holding a street cleaning community service exercise in Chitungwiza. 3 people have been hospitalised.
Doctors begin a strike.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

NOTES: A supporter of a local ZANU PF leader was attacked and beaten by a gang from a rival faction of ZANU PF
PDP leader Tendai Biti's home was burned down in an arson attack. No one was injured.
The doctors' strike that began in Harare the previous week spread to Bulawayo hospitals.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: An MDC-T supporter Shingai Chikwenjere of Chiredzi West is alleged to have been assaulted by unnamed Zanu PF supporters.

NOTES: ZANU PF youths marched in Bulawayo to demonstrate their support for President Mugabe.
2 vendors in the Harare CBD were attacked by Municipal Police Officers, who kicked and punched them.
A civil society activist who had gone to support the doctors, who were striking, was attacked by the police.
War collaborators, war-veterans, and ex-detainees held a march in Chegutu to show their solidarity with Mugabe.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: MDC-T leader Morgan Tsvangirai's private meeting was broken up by armed riot police wielding teargas. Members of the community clashed with the riot police and defended the MDC-T leaders, forcing the police to leave.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU PF youths from the lacoste faction protested at the ZANU headquarters in Bulawayo against G40 faction leaders in the provincial structures.

NOTES: THE Mthwakazi Republic Party (MRP) takes to the streets of Bulawayo today in what its officials claim is a sensitisation exercise on its secessionist philosophy. At the same time, MDC-T youth protested in Bulawayo.

NOTES: Politically motivated violence occurred at a funeral in Mbare on the 11th of March 2017. Zanu Pf youths led by their leader who was identified as Bernard attacked mourners and MDC-T supporters with stones.

Tobacco farmers staged a demonstration at Tobacco Sales Floor  in Harare over the failure by financial institutions to allow them to withdraw $1 000 as earlier announced by a tripartite agreement comprising stakeholders
A Zimbabwe National Army soldier at Suri Suri air base in Chegutu Mashonaland West is battling for life after he was attacked by ten illegal miners.
A sizeable crowd gathered at Zimbabwe Freedom square for Nera demonstration in Harare.

NOTES: Hundreds of Zanu-PF women's league members demonstrated and called for the ouster of their deputy politburo secretary and Bulawayo Provincial Affairs minister and treasurer: Mutare

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU-PF Women's League Deputy Secretary Eunice Nomthandazo Moyo's supporters took to the streets in solidarity with her in Bulawayo.
Soldiers came to the Midlands State University campus, where they randomly assaulted students using sticks. 37 students were injured. 14 have broken limbs. 1 student is in a coma.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: Scores of ZANU youth rampaged through Mbare, assaulting MDC-T supporters, burning down MDC-T supporters' property and shops, and carrying mock coffins for MDC-T supporters. The riot police were called, but they refused to intervene.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: 57 ZANU youth attacked villagers with machetes and knobkerries in Insangu village, in Shangani. There is tension in the village over the distribution of land. 4 people were hospitalised.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: About 1,000 ZANU Youth League and Women's League demonstrators gathered in Bindura to protest against the ZANU Political Commissar, Saviour Kasukuwere.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU supporters held a demonstration against ZANU Political Commissar, Saviour Kasukuwere, in Gweru
A mob of angry vendors protesting the police clean-up of vendors chased the Gweru City Council's Acting Town Clerk and Chamber Secretary.
100 NERA protesters gathered in Freedom Square for a protest. The Riot Police patrolled with truncheons and water cannons.
Under the orders of the First Lady, 16 armed police officers stormed Arnold Farm, burning down houses, assaulting people and arresting a family who resisted them.
MP Temba Mliswa led his constituents in a demonstration against corruption
To protest the fact that they had been evicted from the Gweru streets, vendors continued to sell their wares from vehicles. This has resulted in running battles with the police.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: 2 ZANU youth severely assaulted 2 party members who were walking in the opposite direction to a party meeting. The victims have been hospitalised and one of the youths has been arrested.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: Harare Provincial Commissar for ZANU PF heard that a vote of no confidence would be passed against him and Saviour Kasukuwere, so he bused in a group of demonstrators to protest the vote. The opposing members of the committee then bused in their own demeonstrators and the 2 groups clashed. Civilians were injured in the skirmishes.

Police have been deployed in the Sabi Mine to help the private security forces clear the artisanal gold miners. There have been running battles in the mine shafts between private security and artisanal miners, with reports of gunfire and explosives being used. Several people have been injured in the clashes.
The State Procurement Board Chairperson died when he fell from his office window. There are indications that it was a politically motivated murder.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU PF youths attacked and manhandled a ZANU PF Minister, Christopher Chingosho, because he had criticised the ZANU Youth leader, Chipanga.
A thief was caught by residents, who assaulted him until he lost consciousness. He died in hospital.
